text: We stumbled upon Pasta Idea quite by accident and am so glad we did. The staff was inviting and friendly. We ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce with some trepidation as meat sauce can often be a hit or a miss. It was a big hit and absolutely delicious. You could tell upon first bite the pasta was fresh and homemade. I ordered a single order but the portion was large enough for two people. The fresh Bruschetta was very flavorful and was the perfect compliment to the pasta. We  will be returning here often.

I've been to the restaurant 4 times for my to-go orders. I don't eat there because the restaurant is fairly small. 

The first visit was great back to 3/2017 was great, I'm a big meat ball pasta fan, so I ordered their meat ball pasta with meat sauce. The pasta was great with nice flavor. 

I went back two more times after the first visit. That's when things start to go downward. I didn't get the meatballs with my order, and the portion was very small for the price. I called the manager and he promised he would make things right. 

I've decided to give it one more try, I placed my order on eat24 and noted "please include the meat balls this time". They did include it this time, but the meat balls were under cooked, plus I got an extra metal string as a souvenir. The 5-inch metal string looked like either from a wine bottle or a can. I almost swallowed it....

I regret to give them too many chances to fix the issue. Their kitchen needs some serious management. I give them 2 stars for the sake of the first good experience.

I absolutely adore this place! The server, Hunter, is fantastic and always provides excellent service and has a great personality. It's a small place that is a bit hidden, but is definitely worth the visit. The food is phenomenal. I almost always get the Pink Diablo fettuccini, and it never fails to be delicious! The portions are pretty large. When you order your food, you are also provided with some very wonderful garlic bruschetta bread. I highly recommend this location, especially if you are looking for fresh, fantastic pasta!
Wow!  Great food, great service, and great prices. They deserve their 5 star Yelp rating. We will be returning, often!
Soooo good!  Love the pesto and vodka sauce.  You can really tell the noodles are homemade!

Amazing idea. Pick your pasta, then pick your sauce of which there are so.many it's hard to choose. All freshly.made from the frying pan to your table.
Very small place so if 4 or more call for reservation.
Portions are large.

Happy tummy gives thumbs up (boom) to small local restaurant serving several fresh pastas. The pasta can then be mixed and matched with various sauces. The group of us  shared a caprese salad which was fresh and flavorful.  I had the cavateli and garlic lovers sauce (chicken, plenty of minced garlic, broccoli and sun dried tomato). It was cooked perfectly and very tasty. There was enough pasta to share but we all ordered what we wanted and now we are taking the yummy leftovers home for lunch ( or breakfast?) tomorrow.

Small gem hidden away in a strip mall in Summerlin. All of the dishes were great, I had the Wild Boar Bolognese. The service and prices were reasonable. Definitely going back soon, hopefully they have the boar again. Mgmt, please ping when you do again!
Great taste and great  service. Made fresh pasta with a super great flavor  their chicken parmesan its wonderful.

gone to this place on multiple occasions and never had a bad experience but it's been a while. Ordered through grub hub, an hour later got the food with extra bread for some reason. Opened up the food to find that their was a missing ingredient that costs us 4$ on an order that ended up being about 50$. Called them up and this woman had The audacity to admit that they forgot the extra shrimp which costs 4$ so threw in an extra bread. 1. How retarded are you to admit that right to us and just show how lazy and inconsiderate you were that you knew our order was missing something but still sent it out. Your job is literally to complete orders. And you send it out... Knowing you're missing something. Secondly, you can't replace f*ucking bread for shrimp, like seriously? And thirdly, the women offered no way to reconcile the problem we had to repeatedly ask her what she could do for us which was basically nothing since her manager wasn't there. I wonder if the manager had been there would you have actually completed the order to begin with instead of send it out half assed, get a brain. And maybe some better decision making skills. Bread = shrimp in this alternate universe I guess.
Awesome!!! Cute small place with delicious pasta! Love the spicy marinara! Great service, huge portions! Going to be able to get three meals out of it.

Pasta Idea is more of an order and take home restaurant, so if you are looking for sit down they only have a few tables. That being said, they have every pasta option imaginable and their servings are very generous. I don't love pasta as much as my husband, but the gnocchi I had here was pretty good. :)

Their appetizer bread and sauce is delicious!

This is a wonderful place to eat! If you're in the mood for eating out you can come in or if you just want something fabulous for dinner they also do take-out. You can't miss with this restaurant. If you're in the Lake Mead and Buffalo area you should get my stop in for a taste tantalizing experience. I would suggest that it's worth the drive even if you're not in the area. I enjoyed it greatly and hope you do too.
They have since clarified that they were using Yelp's 3rd party delivery service, and have no drivers of their own, which explains why they were unable to send another driver.

This place is awesome! The staff is very welcoming and attentive and the food is delicious! I had the butternut squash ravioli with speck in a 5 cheese sauce and I think it's one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had! If you love fresh pasta you definitely need to try this place out!

Food is wonderful but this review is for the customer service. 

They accidentally delivered/charged us an extra dish and then refunded our whole meal!

Food is delicious and staff is even nicer!



Go here!!

Best Italian food I have had in Vegas. Husband and wife team make authentic Italian food. I have been here five days straight. Great garlic bread, soups and entrees. Wish I could give them more than five stars!!
Some of the best pasta I've had. Great variety of excellent sauce and pasta combinations. Always enough for leftovers even though I eat a lot.
Fresh flavors that dance in your mouth from the first bite to the last. The pastas and sauces are outstanding--fragrant and tasty. The wait staff was attentive and friendly. A memorable evening!
Hidden gem. Great food. Great service. First time here and will be back without a doubt.

The service is friendly but they are still trying to figure out service and how to handle a lunch rush. I had the pasta with meat sauce. It was okay and rather oily. The wife really enjoyed her spinach ravioli. The garlic bread was good and included in the meal.

This is the best Italian food in Las Vegas. I', totally addicted to this place. No one is better then
this. I'm so glad I live 5 mins away. If you get a chance please try it. Guarantee you will love it.
Great spaghetti with unbelievable delicious homemade sources. The quantity is plenty too and there are a lot of choices.  We'll come back again.

Amazing! Small and cute. Clean and bright. Great service from Isabella. The Putanesca was terrific. Seafood dish as well. Fresh ingredients and a very talented chef/owner. We are local and will be making this a regular stop!!

My name is Agostino. I am 3rd generation Italian from Salerno Italy! This home made pasta is the closest and best Italian food I have had to the real thing! Very impressed and reminds me of my grandparents and how they cooked!! Very impressed! Ciao!

This is quite possibly my favorite place in Las Vegas right now.  The idea of being able to choose which type of pasta and the sauce you want to go with it is incredible.  The flavor they are able to bring out in the sauces and soups are just incredible.
Always so good! Try the ravioli, you won't be disappointed. And the garlic bread is on point! The servers have always been great and very attentive as well :)

This place is great. Best pasta and great way to order sauce. Fresh homemade pasta and yummy sauce. People that work there are super nice. Had dinner there with wife and baby. Super kid friendly. Great for take out or delivery too.

Fresh pasta. Fresh sauce. Fresh dining. Great service. Food was amazing. The lunch special was priced great and the portions were quite large for a lunch plate. I hope this place catches on and stays around.
Amazing authentic Italian food great service will be back here again ! The butter nut squash ravioli won't disappoint

All the times I have eaten this flawless prepared fresh Fettuccine Alfredo the taste is amazing, great consistency and exquisitely divine flavor. Definitely the Best Fettuccine Alfredo i have ever had can not compare it's definitely fresh authentic Italian ingredients.
Macaroni & Cheese
Phenomenal inexpensive flavorful pasta. Top of the line quality pasta.
Pappardelle Carbonara
Fresh Made Noodles is delicious 
Very rich creamy tasteful pasta.
We enjoyed every aspect of our dinner. The pasta was delicious with generous portions and quality ingredients. The staff were also very nice and attentive. We will be be back again and again!

My boyfriend found this while looking around on yelp and I must say I'm so thankful he came across it ! The food is amazing , the service was excellent . As first timers I must say they earned a lifetime customer ! Recommend it to anyone craving pasta , the flavors are very homey and the prices are affordable .

Amazing homemade pasta with huge selection of options. The antipasto was delicious and I loved the homemade soup. There are only a hand full of tables and it is great for smaller parties of 2-5. I will definitely be back!
Small place only about 5 indoor tables 2 outdoor.  Pasta is fabulous sauces are good.  Portions are huge!  Had to take half home.  Highly recommend.
Excellent pasta with perfectly paired sauces. We came from out of town and almost left because of the strip mall atmosphere, but so glad we gave it a try. Yum!

First time here for my late lunch break.  From the reviews, I was expecting some good pasta.  Instead what I got was hella good pasta!  Tried the basic spaghetti alla marinara so I can gauge the taste of simple ingredients.  I know I ate more than I should have, but couldn't help myself.  A side of bruschetta accompanied the pasta - and that disappeared as well.  The place was small and quaint.  Plenty of seat space at 1pm on a Thursday.  The weather was perfect for enjoying next to the open door.  I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.  Can't remember if they had genovese, but definitely would want to try that and the pesto.

Oh, they do have a decent kids menu too.

So excited to review this place I stumbled  upon it by accident its next to Cafe Rio it's not real easy to see from the street and thought I would give it a try . I am so glad I did ! the food is amazing it's authentic Italian fresh and homemade no frozen crap here ! Prices are very reasonable and service is fast and friendly . You get to mix and match pasta and sauces I had the pasta with spicy marinara and olives it was amazing If you love authentic Italian this is a MUST try

I love this place! They have great fresh Italian food.  Guess what??? Everyone who works there is Italian!  I had pasta with vodka sauce, shrimp, scallops, asparagus, mushrooms, and tomatoes.  My friend had fettuccine Alfredo. They started us off with fresh bruschetta. Delish! Soup and salad. Delish! Service was superb! This is one of my new favorite spots!

Went here looking for a good pasta place discovered this gem. Great selection with the option to choose the type of noodles and type of sauce. Great portions, love that they give you enough food. Most pasta places are too watery and the size is small. Love the owners also. Keep up the good work. Will be back.

Wow, wow, wow. Stop what you are doing right now and go here. There is a chicken parmigiana meal that is the size of Mars, Walmart, and a semi truck combined. I touched it, ate it, did ten jumping jacks and then drank a beer. In answering the question whether it makes me hungry, yes!

Great service and pretty good food. I ordered the spaghetti and my daughter ordered the fettuccine Alfredo. They were both decent... but nothing out of the ordinary. Although I did enjoy the small intimate setting. I must say... it is rather pricey.

First time and won't ever come again. Called in for pick up, 30 min wait, drove there and they didn't even have our order started. Wasted our time, manager didn't even apologize and was borderline rude as got our money back. Big disappointment. Other people inside were upset with long wait. Do not come here for pick up you'll be let down.

What happened to Pasta Idea???  I've been coming here almost every week from the time they opened. I've always bragged about how great the food was, to about everyone I know. But now, it's not the same! It's under new ownership as of a few days ago, and the food is terrible! Where did the original owners go? I hope they open another restaurant because I won't be back here!! All the positive reviews posted about Pasta Idea are based on the original owners, and they are now gone! Don't waste your time coming here! Awful!!

Small and intimate seating area. Phenomenal food and portion sizes. I was there for lunch and had the special, which was enough for lunch and dinner that day. Friendly staff and environment. Will definitely be going back!

This place made my wife sick. She ordered the carbonara, and when we got it the food was really oily, and it looked like they heated it a microwave. When we called later to let them know the manager insisted that the food was fine, and that my wife was just sick. Now we know why this place was shut down in the past.
Coming from a Italian Sicilian family I've only at my family's pasta and sauce. This place has the freshest and best quality of pasta I've ever had outside of homemade!!

This place is soooo good! As someone who comes from a long line of Italians who make awesome Italian food, I can say this was some delicious pasta! My pappardelle was cooked to perfection! The bruschetta that came with the meal was delicious as well.

   As some have stated, the place is very small (though it's next to a currently vacant space, so maybe we'll get lucky and they'll expand?). The atmosphere is nice. A little cozy due to the small space, but quite fresh/modern in appearance. Reminded me a lot of the pasta pomodoro near good ol' SCU. 

   Food was wonderful, although the lunch special could use a bit of work business strategy-wise. It would have been nice for our gluten-free member of they had included it as an option, even if it came at a dollar or so up-charge. It would have been nice if they included some more of the sauces at an up charge as well. 

   Price-wise it was a little on the expensive side, since we all ordered non-lunch special items. However, the quality and portions of food, along with the bruschetta was totally worth the price. 

  Last bit, I had the ice tea to drink, and it was quite different than what I'm used to getting at a restaurant. It had a coffee-ish undertone that was surprisingly pleasant!

This place is definitely one of the best restaurants you will find when in search of fresh pasta and fresh ingredients while still remaining true to authentic Italian flavor.

Being a Las Vegas native, born and raised, I figured this place was going to be just like every other Italian place. Needless to say, my husband and I were pleasantly surprised. 

We were greeted almost immediately and seated with drinks served shortly after. Our two year old child was accompanying us, and he was offered crayons and a coloring paper to keep him occupied. 

Fresh bruschetta was served immediately following. The bread itself was fresh out of the oven with a crisp golden color on the outside, and the soft, warm texture in the middle of a perfectly baked bread. The bread itself had been delicately brushed over the top with a mixture of olive oil, fresh Italian herbs, and a hint of parmesan. The herbs were so fresh that you could tell they came immediately off of the plant as they lacked that crispy, dried texture of herbs that are obtained from the store or bottled herbs. The tomato mixture of the bruschetta was served in a small separate bowl instead of on top of the bread like other restaurants serve it which prevented the bread from getting soggy. The tomato bruschetta mixture contained the same fresh herbs. The tomatoes themselves were fresh, crisp, and slightly sweet in taste. The combination of both complimented each other perfectly.


I ordered the chicken parmigiana. The chicken itself was of a high quality, tender cut with absolutely no fat or grisly pieces, evenly coated, topped with a baked mozzarella cheese blend over the top, slightly golden brown. When you cut into it, the melted cheese mixed with the perfect amount of crispy batter over the chicken was enough to keep your mouth watering. The combination of the marinara sauce set this dish over the top of any competitor. My grandfather is from Sicily, and this was the only sauce I have ever tasted in comparison to his. In Italy, the people will ONLY pick and use what is in season. It has to be perfect, and this chef chose the perfect seasonal tomato to make a fresh, sweet, marinara sauce that you can only find here. Every Italian recipe for sauce is different, but I found this one to be most like my grandfather's which will always be my favorite. Since he is no longer around, this is definitely my new Italian go to spot for pasta!

The taste of authentic Italian food differs greatly from the Americanized marinara sauces you'll find at Olive Garden chain type Italian restaurants which is why some may not like the taste, but this is authentic Italian food. For those of you who are Italian, that is hard to come by now days.

If this isn't enough to get you to visit, my husband is a fine dining chef who has worked at both the Wynn and the Paris. He has also worked in the presence of Chef Gordon Ramsay. At times I get irritated because my husband is one of the most critical, pickiest, worst people to take to restaurants because he's such a foodie snob. Even he liked the food. His only complaint was that he thought the shrimp was slightly undercooked, but enjoyed his meal (fettuccine with shrimp alfredo sauce) very much which is a huge compliment coming from him! Lol

Food was delicious! They start you off with bread; warm and buttery! Our pasta was incredible; definitely can tell that they care about their food. My husband had the meat sauce and they did not skimp on the meat. My marinara sauce was just perfect.
We love supporting local family owned restaurants and will definitely come back when we are in town!
Service was attentive and friendly.

Food portions are a 5-Star.

Food quality 3.5 Star

Restaurant is just a few tables so no way to give that more than 2 stars although it's clean it's just a sliver of tables and they are pretty full. 

Take out service 4 Star

I need to try more stuff in the future but here is what I've tried:
Baked rigatoni:  4.5 star   (Portion size 5 star)
Ravioli with chicken marsala sauce (3 star) 
Garlic Bread: 3 star 
Fetuccini alfredo: 3 star   (Portion size 5 star) 

The portion size is the big plus for this place and the food is pretty darn good!  I will be back.
Try it out!
A fantastic family-owned, hidden gem tucked away off the beaten path!  Great portions, amazing flavor, with fresh ingredients. Can't get much better. Highly recommend this place!

Great food, great service!  We came in between soccer games and they got us in and out quickly.  I highly recommend this restaurant.  It was a little expensive but that's ok because of the quality and  the fact that everything is homemade
Great home made pasta.  Chose a pasta- add a sauce. Very casual interior, more atmosphere in outside seating . We tend to order pickup and share one order as the serving is generous.
Excellent gnocchi!!! Paired it with the lunch special of grape tomatoes, mushrooms, in a creamy garlic sauce. Tiramisu was good.
Found this place on Yelp, now been back 3 times in 2 weeks. INCREDIBLE food!!! 5 stars

What a delightful find. This tiny little gem has Italian favorites as well as gourmet dishes that are as tasty as any I've had in Italy. I had the pesto Gorgonzola sauce with al dente rigatoni. Delicioso!
Service by Jeremias was delightful. I'll be back for sure

This place is awesome. Their baked butternut squash ravioli is my favorite and it's just amazing. Though probably not so good for the waistline. The noodles are obviously made fresh and I haven't met a sauce yet that I didn't really like. My personal recommendations for sauces are the Campania, Amatriciana, Trentino, and Marsala.

One thing that needs to be mentioned is that seating is EXTREMELY limited. There is seating for maybe 25 people comfortably. There is a little more seating outside, but I have never done more than walk by the outside tables so I can't say for sure.

I love this place,its a really good place,has a twist when it comes to Italian food however is for the good of the restaurant,small place but unique and delicious,I strongly recommended it. The garlic bread is delicious

This place has really good pasta but it's nothing you can't make at home. But when you're out and about and in the mood for some yummy pasta and don't want to cook at home this is a good choice.
You get free bread with your purchase which is always a plus.
I always order the cavatappi with pink vodka sauce. The portions are nice but I feel with the price they could be just a little bigger.
Seating is very limited so if you want to feed a few people or don't want to feel a bit awkward eating in such a small place definitely get it to go.

Pastaidea is amazing! Their pastas dishes are THE BEST PASTAS my wife & I have ever had at any restaurant in the US...EVER! I have never eaten better pasta in my life and I was born and raised in Italy. Only restaurants in Italy are better, or on par with this place. The sauces are flavorful, authentic, and made to perfection!!! We love the food here so much, we eat here twice a week. They also serve garlic bread with bruschetta sauce for free as part of your meal....which is also fantastic. The service is prompt and friendly. The prices are fair, since the quality is soooo good and the portions are huge. ENJOY!!!

Tried the food for the first time this weekend. It was everything and more. My mom flew in from the Bay Area and we decided we wanted Italian food. I had heard about how good Pasta Idea was so we ordered. We had it delivered. The delivery man was very nice and professional. 
She had the Baked rigatoni  & I the Mushroom ravioli with the pesto & gorgonzola sauce. I would have to say it was some of the best ravioli I have ever had. 
We are Sicilian and eat a lot of Italian food - This by far is the best in Las Vegas!! Will definitely be making this a regular spot !

What a great place.   Fantastic food, well prepared, and very friendly owners.   3 of us ate there and all the dishes were excellent.   I'm from out of town and plan to eat here again when I return.  I even went as far as telling the hotel staff to add this place as a hotel recommendation.    The Red Diablo is awesome!

This is the best gluten free pasta I have ever had. The sauce is very flavorful and delicious. The sausage and peppers are wonderful. Closest thing to North Beach in SF I have had in Las Vegas. Imported ingredients from Italy.

So I need some pasta. Didn't want to drive. Punched in Spaghetti near me and found PastaIdea. Been driving past this place for two years and never saw it. Well ya don't need to worry about that. Small intimate family owned real Italian. I'm not even Italian. I've had Spaghetti from the Strip to Centennial Hills. For me pasta is either an emotional event or may as well be Chef Boy R Dee. This is up there with the best in town. The sauce has a nice tangy that I'm still trying to place and I didn't have to fight to get the meat sauce to last. Good stuff.

More like Bad Idea. My girlfriend orderd the Chicken Alfredo. And I ordered the meat sauce with meat balls spaghetti. Her dish was slightly better than mine no chicken really but sauce had somewhat of  flavor.. my dish was lacking the flavor component. Meatballs cooked right but just so bland no taste meatsauce same thing..so bottom line Yikes! on Yelp! for this one wont be goin bak.. I understand organic and Fresh but no Flavor..dont see this business  goin to far.

The pasta here is awesome. Very cool and simple concept- pick your pasta then pick your sauce. Portions are generous. I chose the butternut squash ravioli with carbonara sauce and I practically licked my plate. Meatball sub was huge. Kids Mac and cheese was delicious. Hubby had lobster ravioli with pink vodka sauce and was pleased.

Only downside was the decor was not up to scale with their prices. Each plate is about $15-20. 

Service was very good. Friendly and courteous staff. 

Will definitely be back

This is a cute little place. The bread is to die for and the pasta is heaven. I had lobster ravioli with pink vodka sauce. Pure bliss!!!!! This is a must stop for locals or visitors. If you haven't been here you are missing out. I will be going back as soon as I can. Heaven!

The cheese ravioli with vodka sauce is pretty good. You can taste the fresh parsley inside the ravioli and the vodka sauce is so creamy. Good quality, homemade taste. The garlic bread they serve before you order is delicious, especially with the diced herbed tomato it's served with. I can't wait to come back and try something else.

I ordered 3 spaghetti and meatballs dinner for delivery 7pm. I was not notified that they received my order, but the monies were immediately taken out of my account. I called the restaurant, and they could hardly hear me. I had to shout very loud. I don't know why they don't answer their phone in a quieter place. The background noise in the place was very loud. I hope I get our food tonight by 7pm.
1st time to this resturant have to say my husband and I were extremely pleased. Great food, Great price, large portions.... last but not least GREAT service
This was incredible. The best handmade pasta we've had since our trip to Northern Italy. I highly recommend to everyone! The bigoli pasta with marinara is a must try along with their cesar salad.
We ordered an order if spaghetti & meatballs and a Caesar salad. Both were fine, not the worst but not the best either, just ok.

Love coming here.. you could tell the pasta is freshly made! I always get the Alfredo chicken and it's soooo good I love! Yes it can be pricey but it's the same price as going to Olive Garden but better quality and less wait time! 
Also comes with freshly baked bread for every order!

(unrelated) mother f... this is the 3rd time i had to re-write this dang review. freakin yelp didnt save it even though originally it did GRRRR

SIDE NOTE - THEY HAVE TO REMOVE THAT PastaIdea Radio. Or implement a function to turn it off. It turns back up on max volume when you change pages. UGH

ANYWAYS... this place is known for its homemade fresh noodles and sauces made in-house daily. There used to be a place on the SW side by Flamingo and Grand Canyon that had a similar feature but they disappeared only after 2 visits. 

PastaIdea has a "Lunch Special" which allows a selection from a starred (*) noodle and matched with a starred (*) sauce for $9.95 including a fountain drink and garlic bread (Available for dine in AND take out !) 

I had originally came here prior to meeting my accountant to do some taxes. I dont come to this side of town too often which was why it took me so long to visit this place. PastaIdea opens at 11am and i had came here shortly after. Located on the NW corner of Lake Mead and Buffalo, its in a small shopping center between Bucca di Beppo and McDonalds. It kind of "hides" in the middle of the center facing away from the parking lot but its there. 

Its a small little restaurant with maybe 5 tables seating 20 people total. Since the restaurant was empty and im not one to like to dine alone, i opt'ed to take it out to eat next to the lake at Desert Shores... xD 

Picking fettuccine noodles matched with arrabbiata sauce, they were both starred items which worked with the lunch special. As mentioned before, the noodles are fresh made as well as the sauces. The arrabbiata sauce is made with a spicy marinara and olives. The marinara is fresh and bright. The spice was a small kick but not as spicy as i had preferred. But for a nice warm day with a small breeze, it was nice. The fettuccine noodles were nice and al dente. The olives was a mix of green and black pitted olives and there was quite the generous amount. Having bursts of flavor from the olives with the generous amount of noodles and marinara, it was a good amount of food, especially for lunch. 

As mentioned before, it comes with garlic toast and a side of tomatoes mixed with chopped basil, which gives it a very refreshing, bright taste when you put it on top of the toast and eaten together. 

Second time i had came here, i had picked something not included in the lunch special (as i dont know when the next time i'd get the chance to come here, so i "went all out in a way"). I picked the fresh cavatelli pasta this time, which are like small long pasta shells, similar to mini hot dog buns. LOL I paired the pasta with a creamy white sauce, the Veneto, with asparagus, grape tomatoes, proscuitto crudo, and mushrooms. Proscuitto crudo is essentially the typical proscuitto you are probably familiar with. Crudo means raw whereas cotto means cooked. The sauce was SUPER heavy and creamy but worked well. Grape tomatoes cut in half punched through the heaviness fairly well. Proscuitto gave it a nice "natural" saltiness to the bite with the earthy taste of mushrooms. My only real complaint is the asparagus was tough to eat. Had some very tough pieces so they needed a trimming. The cavatelli pasta was AMAZING. VERY al dente with its elasticity and incomparable bite. 

With the choices of 16 different noodles paired with 40 sauces, the combinations are almost endless. I would love to return to try other sauces. It does get a little pricey because of the sauce costs in ingredients they use probably, but once in a while, i think its pretty worth it.

Never again. Between the inedible lasagna and rude staff, I'm done. We used to really like this place. But recently service and food quality has deteriorated. Tonight we ordered to go and by the time I got home (10 minutes to first bite) the food was ice cold. When I arrived I was the only guest there with 3-4 people behind the counter. The girl behind the register only acknowledged me when I finally asked her "am I talking to myself?" to which she responded "it's $33". Totally overpriced for a salad, lasagna, small slice of cheesecake and kid's mac n cheese. Esp since I didn't eat the lasagna.

This just opened a day or two ago.  They are in walking distance from my house so we decided to try it last night. It's buried between cafe rio and buca DI peppo so it's hard to see. We had the antipasto mista, rigatoni w meat sauce , cavatelli  Campania, and spaghetti w clam white wine sauce. And each one was better than the other. The pasta being made in house was delicious and everybody's favorite out of the 3 pastas was the Campania. It was rich and fresh and just out of this world good w the cavatelli.  Everything is so good we are going back tonight to try some more dishes. I highly recommend them and will take pics tonight

Great little find!  Food was excellent. FRESHEST pasta ever. My 10 yr old son begrudgingly ordered off the kids' menu and it was a pleasant surprise for him to see the portion to be quite big!  Quaint and limited seating, but the FOOD IS EXCELLENT!!
So many sauces to choose from! The options are endless. Plus the service was really great. We love this place.

Heard about it from a friend.  Thank you friend!  Wonderfully friendly staff and extremely helpful with the menu.  Great options with primary selections being sauce choice and pasta choice.  My wife and I chose different menu items and shared.  Great and distinct flavors - bravo!  The prices are reasonable, and they are very well setup for delivery.  We shall become regulars and bring our friends.
M. Fefferman

The food is okay. I expected more from the homemade noodles gimick but the owners and staff do not believe in the concept. That is apparent. It's for money only. When you walk in you'll stand at the cash register for quite a bit of time and the staff will walk by you without saying anything. It's pretty bad customer service I wouldn't say that they're rude but they don't try to make you feel comfortable and they don't seem to enjoy their job and there definitely isn't an Italian warm feel to the place. I got pesto spaghetti and it came out to $17 which I was a bit surprised by especially since the food is mediocre. The pesto sauce was watery and bitter like an amateur made it and although it wasn't disgusting I have to say it was by far the worst pesto sauce I've ever had. I'll be surprised if this place lasts. I read some of the other reviews and I was also put off by the fact that the owner will respond to other peoples yelp reviews in a very rude and defense of tone rather than having a genuine interest in improving the place and catering to the customers.  I think that says a whole lot about the place.

Second trip in this place. Second time I have been thoroughly impressed. The owner lady is who waited on us. Love her to death and she is definitely Italian.. The food here is made to order and is always hot and very fresh. The wait staff is always concerned with how the food is. I can not think of a better italian place here in North Vegas. Will be returning here often..

My husband and I saw the reviews for Pastaidea and decided to give it a try. I'm so glad we did. The food was outstanding. The service was impeccable. We ordered the prosciutto appetizer. Delicious. My husband ordered the spaghetti carbonara and I had chicken Parmesan and cheese ravioli. The portions are huge, the homemade pastas were cooked perfectly and the sauces were delicious. My chicken was expertly friend and had just the right amount of cheese.  I took home more than half of my meal. We ordered tiramisu and cannoli to go. Both wee mouthwatering. We will eat here again, and again.

Update 3/2. This time we ordered to carry out. My husband couldn't get enough of the carbonara, so he ordered that again. Delicious.  I had the diablo pink sauce.  Just as delicious.  Portions are huge.  I ate what was left of mine for lunch the next day.  We will come again and again.

***update...based on the pictures sent to eat24 I am getting a full refund. The restaurant refused to acknowledge how horrible their food and customer service was. Based on their reply to my review it's obvious they have ZERO clue what good food is and also have no clue about customer service. 


If I could give zero stars or less I would...the food was inedible. Meatballs were RAW. Sauce tasted like paste. Croutons were actually chunks of bread. When I called they hung up in me 2 times. When eat24 called they laughed at them. So unprofessional. Run fast and far away...do not eat here EVER.
This is fresh pasta with awesome sauce and great prices.    I will cater soon, but we love the take out.

This was my first visit to PastaIdea. Visiting Las Vegas from Los Angeles and craving Italian food, I did an online search and found PastaIdea among the search results. The name almost prevented me from going there because it seems like a strange, and not particularly inviting, name for a restaurant but the food had good online reviews so I decided to try it. The restaurant is very small, has little eye appeal and even less atmosphere. Doesn't really look or feel like an Italian restaurant but looks more like a space that would be used for a coffee bar or frozen yogurt shop. The food was very good - well prepared and flavorful. But the woman that served us, although quite pleasant and helpful, was behind the counter preparing a take-out order for someone and kept putting her fingers in her mouth to moisten them to open the plastic bags to put the to-go containers in. Should a food server be putting their fingers in their mouth and then touching plates to serve to customers? It's disgusting and probably a health code violation besides. Based on the overall experience, I will probably not return in the future.

Too bad. We used to eat there frequently when they first opened and it was good. Over time, the quality started to drop - especially the quality of the proteins (meat, chicken) - so we stopped for a while. We tried it again after a long break and found that quality had dropped even more!
The carbonara sauce we had for example, had mystery pancetta in it. All the pieces of pancetta were some strange mangled sinew and fat that once in your mouth, you have no choice but to spit it out (how gross) or gag on it! I never even knew it was possible for Pancetta to have sinew and chewy parts like that. It was Disgusting!
The Veneto sauce also seems to have suffered from cutting corners on quality of the speck in it. It also was very skimpy on the asparagus, and half the cherry tomatoes were still green!
I believe this was the last chance we're going to give them. Instead of maintaining quality or improving, they seem to be slipping into a very nasty place with questionable ingredients and no quality control. Paying almost $70 for 3 very bad pasta dishes, seems insane. So never again!
The pasta is delicious. My only gripe is delivery, i would order more often but $8.99 for a delivery charge is insane.

I recently moved to the area and was pleased to see their was an Italian Restaurant very close to my new home that had a very positive rating on Yelp. I have eaten lunch in the Restaurant and had home delivery twice and all three times I could not believe just how good the pasta was. I lived in Europe for 5 years and visited Italy many times. Pasta Idea is the real deal. The pasta is made there and that makes all the difference. While the restaurant may look plain, let me assure you that you will not get better Pasta anywhere on the strip. And the portions are really large and usually enough to enjoy for lunch the next day. I don't recommend many places buy this is one that you must try.

Came here for the grand opening a couple months ago with my friend and it was the best pasta I've ever had in Vegas! I believe it's a family owned place and they're extremely nice! Definitely worth it and the portions are great and filling too! Go when you have the chance I promise you won't regret it!

Ordered delivery, we are a picky family with our order. All of our requests were met, but no bread with any of our 5 meals ordered. Food was bland and not worth the wait. Sorry won't waste another 75 bucks on this place.

This place is amazing. Super affordable, clean, and delicious! So what you do first is pick your noodle (which is freshly made btw) and then your sauce. They have about 30 different sauces here. They give you complimentary toasted bread and tomatoes while you wait. The food came out pretty quick and the portions are huge! Service was great too:)

I'll be the first to say it: when I drove by, pulled up the rave reviews, and visited their website, I kind of scoffed at their claims of fresh-made pasta and sauces. Noodles & Co has been doing this for years, and we already have Mac Shack as a local version- same concept for all.

But my dinner here was really pretty great- I dig the modern kitchen decor, and the service is charming with a prominent Italian accent and genuine warmth. You pick from a variety of pastas and sauces, and add on apps, salads, soups, and/or desserts if you so desire. Note that pastas and sauces/toppings are priced separately, so this can add up- it's no bottomless Olive Garden bargain. 

The mushroom ravioli ($5) was a generous portion of large, lightly-stuffed pillows. I opted for the pesto gorgonzola ($9), which was creamier than expected and quite rich. I would love to see them add a regular, robust pesto to the menu rather than just the cheesed version.

Was a bit disappointed with the caprese salad ($11)- the tomatoes were underripe and flavorless, which didn't rise to the level of the the fresh mozzarella, basil, and other vegetables. I realize they're new, but until they can get a supplier who can provide fresh, ripe tomatoes, perhaps this should be sidelined or only featured as a special.

Split the pasta and salad for a large dinner, gave the rest to my guy- along with the complimentary bruschetta that comes with each order. Giant amount of food, total was just under $30, with tip. 

NOTE: The lunch "specials" offer very limited, basic selection. Hopefully they will expand what is covered in this category. I currently cannot recommend it as a lunch spot, despite working nearby.

Unbelievably good pasta.  The best!  Baked mushroom ravioli was so good.  My knees buckled.  I had to slow down to catch my breath.  Everything is fresh.  The pasta and sauce is fresh.  Nothing compares.

This place is well known for their gourmet pasta! 
Try the marinera sauce! 
Pasta is freshly made and their sauces are incredible! 
Wonderful service, a small restaurant with Big pasta ideas !  
My favorite Marinera with any pasta  
A little expensive, worth your every cent!

Excellent pasta. Clean restaurant. Friendly staff. Reasonable prices. Large portions. Free Bruchetta.
We will definitely be back.

We have been here several times, and the food and service has always been excellent, but yesterday was much different.  I don't know if this is new ownership, but they didn't seem to know the menu well.  I'm vegetarian, so I usually get something a bit more customized, like a certain sauce, but without the meat.  In the past, they have been super accommodating and suggested which things might pair the best.  We ordered two dishes and wanted them spicy.  Took our food to go.  All four of us were truly disappointed.  It wasn't spicy at all, and it was just totally bland, with the exception of garlic.  I seriously doubt we will go back.  Another thing I really didn't like is that they had a child in the dining area watching the Disney channel on TV.  That's great that you have a family business, family restaurant, but if we were dining in, that's a big turn-off in terms of ambiance.  Granted, it was just 5:00 p.m., and no one else was dining, so maybe they turn it off when they have patrons dining in.  Used to love it, but not anymore.

Just ordered from here for the first time. They were here sooner than expected and the food was awesome. This is coming from a food snob. Highly recommend it. Plus, the delivery guy was pretty cool too. Thumbs up all around.

This place was amazing I would go there every day but than I would get tired of pasta but not their pasta because it is so good I would have to say the best is gnocchi with pesto which would be my favorite
Best pasta place in Vegas. Great staff... always clean inside. We come here often and try different things. We are never disappointed!
I am definitely recommending this place!!! Cute little place and the service was excellent. Plates were amazingly huge and the food was sooooo delicious!!! Can't wait to eat my left overs lol!!!

Just tried this place tonight and it was AMAZING. So many different sauce options; I chose to get the pesto & goronzola mixed with the pesto ligauria (not sure if I spelled that right) and the cheese tortellini noodles I chose had a very good flavor and texture. Seriously the best pasta ever, and I'm Italian. Haha. Oh, and their Nutella cheesecake is to die for!!

My order was a to go order, for the price you pay the servings are gigantic, I only ate less than half of my pasta and I'm eating the cheesecake as I write this review, seriously though, if the pasta had sucked (which it did NOT) I would still come back just for this heavenly cheesecake  

So I'm pretty much in love with this place.
Strongly encourage everyone & their mother to go here!

And I really, really, really want to buy an entire Nutella cheesecake from you guys and just eat nothing but cheesecake for like a week. (Seriously, this needs to happen)

This restaurant used to be fantastic. And I'm talking about less than a year ago. There have been recipe changes and significant portion size decreases over the past several months. Specifically, sauces for dishes have turned 180 degrees in the wrong direction.  I used to look forward to their bruschetta with every order. Today they sent toasted bread with sides of marinara. Why has this place gone to crap? If you have a successful recipe (and they had many), why would you change it and affect the quality of the product?  My only guess is that the owner or manager may not have responsibly handled food costs.  But at the same time, if I'm spending $15-$18 for a simple pasta dish, at least give a decent portion.  I will not be ordering again. Too disappointing.

I have read & heard great things about this place. I really like the idea of create your own pasta where you choose your pasta , sauce , and toppings like meat and mushrooms , etc. Each single one is individually priced. Maybe if I ordered the more "dinner-type" menu items & went all out w/ my pasta I would have appreciated the food here more but we settled with their lunch specials since we thought it would be a good deal since comes w/ drink + bruschetta for about 10$.

Lunch menu options were limited and basic in terms of pasta choices and sauces. Hopefully they will expand this category. It also does not come with any meat options (have to pay additional).

I ordered the tri color tortellini + pink vodka sauce (which is mix of their marinara sauce + alfredo sauce + dash of vodka I believe). Tortellini I liked but pink vodka sauce tasted kinda canned. I know it's really not canned but tasted similar. My bf tried the ravioli + alfredo & it was just alright to me. It also looked like I had larger portion size than his. I think I enjoyed the bruschetta more than the actual meal itself.

This is my favorite place to eat! I drive from Henderson just to get their homemade pasta carbonara. I get the bugoli pasta (I think that's how it's spelled). It's a nice, casual no fuss place. Plus, the service is impeccable.
This place is the bomb!! Great fresh made pastas and sauces!! Find them on Facebook for a coupon!!

Pastaidea is amazing Italian.  I wish they had salmon because I eat kosher so I normally can just do the pasta but regardless the food is to die for.  My favorite dish is the cheese ravioli with pink sauce by a land slide.  I thought the Alfredo dish was too heavy for my liking.  I order here all the time. Seriously delicious italian!
Great food and service! Super friendly staff. All the pasta is fresh. I recommend this to any pasta lover.

Fantastic! A small restaurant tucked away. The selection is quite extensive- pick your pasta and then your sauce.. BUT here is the catch- the pasta  is made fresh! The dishes are prepared with such pride - the presentation and taste was better than any 5 star restaurant I have ever eaten in. I ordered the Shrimp Scampi over pappadelle served with grape tomatoes and baby asparagus. Just the way the asparagus was cut was impressive.. My friend ordered the cheese ravioli with pink diablo sauce- the dish had with pepperoni, sausage, peppers, pepperoncini and sundried tomatoes spicy - Amazing!  Sam- our waitress was great- Will definitely go back!

Went there for the first, and last, time last Tuesday. I ordered their lunch special which the girl said I could only order from a few sauces even though I wanted Meat Sauce. After eating their she handed me a coupon that had the same Lunch Special on it but said ANY sauce, I mentioned that and she said they do it that way to get the customer back. Well don't you think that the first visit is the most important? I do!.  I WON"T be back.

Huge portions! Once you see how much you get you'll understand the prices. I enjoyed the chicken parm with my hubs and there was still plenty left for a small lunch the next day. SB: I'm not a huge fan of salt but he is and that's was his only critique, "It could use a little more salt." The sauces aren't from a jar and the pasta is delicious, even my picky teen likes when I grab this on the way home. The staff are very friendly, I only wish they were in a larger location for sit down meals. All in all we'll continue to keep this on our "I'm not cooking" restaurant rotation.
Best pasta I have ever had. No kidding. The pasta is homemade and all the dishes are delicious and high quality. The owners could not be more friendly. This place is AMAZING!
Charged me 5 dollars for butter on pasta for my kids?? Times 2!! Really? Server said owner knows about it but won't change it. Will never come back !

Came for lunch after getting a menu placed on my car. I feel the food was right in line with price. Great little corner restaurant with exceptional food. Pasta was hot and delicious. Staff was friendly and prompt. I'm a stickler for good service and they took care of everything. I'll be back for sure.
Super delicious! Had the baked rigatoni and it was soooo good! Brought half of it home because there was so much. Staff was great. Garlic bread was great. Pasta was delicious! Go!

"Wow, what a great find" was something my wife and i said .. well paraphrasing of course while we ate our last minute dinner at this new pasta joint.

We ordered a kids mac and cheese, a chicken parm, and lasagna.

Lasagna: cooked perfectly. Great taste with lots of layers. My only complaint was that it was a tad bit dry... and i mean just a tad. 4.5/5

Chicken parm: it was my wife's meal and it was a big meal if i must say. Lots of great flavor and chicken cooked just right. 4/5

Mac and cheese: was absolutely delicious! I was hoping my kids didnt finish it and i was lucky enough to eat a couple bites and had the opportunity to finish it for left overs! The cheese on that though..... yummmmmm!!!

Oh! And their garlic bread with tomato dip! Wow. Yumm

Love this place. The venue is small, but cozy. Service was friendly and fast. My only complaint is the overall price. $15 -$20 for each of the adult meals and i think about $10 for the mac and cheese. 

But, I'd definitely go again!!

Added pics!
This place is very homey and seems family run. They messed up my order but fixed it immediately. Very tasty and will be back again for sure

Wow just wow, my girlfriend found this place while working and said. We needed to try it out. So that is what we did and now will be making return trip after return trip to this Amazing Mom & Pop Italian Pasta Spot! Hand made Pastas and Sauces to die for. She had Fettuccine with Pink Diablo Sauce and I had lobster ravioli with clam and mussel red sauce. We had some amazing garlic bread and when I joking asked for a loaf of it the sop up the delicious sauce our waitress return with a plate of garlic beard which I put to use. I can not wait to go back and try a different combination of pasta and sauce. Vegas has some amazing Italian places and in my opinion Pasta Idea ranks right up the with best of them. Did I mention that both our plates were huge and it was under $50 for the entire dinner! simply fantastic.
Hands down the best Italian food in town. Friendly staff, consistently amazing food, and an all around great time. And you can't forget about how fresh everything is--from the bread to the sauces.

This small spot has really great service and is welcoming. The menu is amazing if you're a pasta lover. First time in Las Vegas that I haven't regretted going out for pasta instead of making it at home, bravo.
Homemade pasta with large variety of gravy. Food is excellent. The only drawback is the place is very, very small. Pasta with clams is the best in Las Vegas.
Millions of possible combos of dishes. The staff are extremely friendly and the food is fresh and amazing! The only downside is the smaller size of the restaurant.

I recently got takeout from this place, and I totally loved it! 

I got the pappardelle noodles, and they were so fresh and delicious! I got the Fra Diablo sauce with Shrimp and Scallops, and the sauce was good! Insanely flavorful and a good amount of spice. Not sure if I would get it again, just because the scallops are chewy little mini scallops, but the shrimp were awesome.

We also ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. I didn't taste it, but it smelled so good. 

Lastly, the Nutella cheesecake was great (and cheap!)
Perfect way to end the meal. The staff was really nice too when we ordered and picked up.

I am so excited to dine in here and try more dishes! Totally impressed with the quality so far.
Fresh Pasta, great prices, and friendly servers. This place is my favorite Italian place in town!

This place is by far the best pasta place I have ever tried , the pasta was amazing and the noodles were so fresh and are really homemade . Our waiter was extremely nice and polite and very attentive . They serve really big portions and you get full quickly . I absolutely loved this place and will definitely recommend . I really cant wait to bring the rest of my family to come and try it . The food is so full of flavor and everyone is so welcoming , walking into this place and eating here you feel like you're at home having dinner with family . If you haven't tried this place you're really missing out it's AMAZING . It will probably be one of the best places you eat out at .

Great find! Tucked back in a corner, but super friendly staff. Food was fresh, excellent and cooked to perfection. Highly recommend this place for your pasta desires. I wish they had more locations throughout the valley. This one is not close to us, but while visiting family and decided to grab a bite. Very glad we chose PastaIdea.

Well, here I am 5 days later with high hopes and everything was a complete 180 from last time. The service was awful. We were a party of 2 and there were 2 other tables seated in the restaurant. It seemed to take forever to have our orders taken. The food didn't seem nearly as fresh as it came out only moments after ordering, telling me the prepared dishes were simply heated up before being delivered to our table. After dinner I pointed out, to the very impersonal  waitress our displeasure in our meal. She seemed to have many excuses as to why the service was poor, such as "the other waitress is new", "it's our busiest time and we don't make enough money to have an extra waitress here for 8 hours when we're only busy for a couple hours" or "we had several phone orders coming in for pick up or delivery." This experience has brought my 5 star review quickly to a 2 star review. Will not be returning.

Absolutely blown away by this gem!  It was our first time their last night and wow!  The customer service was phenomenal!  The food was SO delicious and SO fresh!  Everything is made to order and that truly is the case.  I ordered the basil pesto creamy cheese ravioli and it was the BEST pasta in town!  Lol then I tried my husbands chicken Alfredo pasta and that was just heavenly... HIGHLY recommended!  They are also SO generous with the portions of everything!  Also while you wait you get the most delicious garlic bread with a very unique tomato dipping sauce!  So good!  And don't forget dessert!  We ordered cheese cake (so rich and creamy) and a tiramisu (so fluffy and the custard was almost like an ice cream... yummy)!!!!  The restaurant was so clean, tidy, and had a very warm and cozy family feeling to it with such a friendly staff!  It is a awesome place for a date night or a family dinner!  I don't see us ever going to Olive Garden again or any other pasta place for that matter!  We will be going back SOON and I will update with pictures!  Again HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!!!!!!

This is great pasta period.

Fresh - the sauces - which matters MOST - are tasty, hearty, plentiful & HOT - we have this delivered mostly and it comes HOT and FRESH!

Awesome pasta dishes - meat sauce - meat ravioli which is impossible to find anymore! Spaghetti and meatballs are yummy!

Seriously - this IS the place for Italian pasta and you'll keep coming back for more!

PS - they smartly ship take out in BOXES - NOT Styrofoam which makes noodles MUSHY!  One of the few restaurants to figure this out yet!

We love this place! !  OMG! Finally a restaurant that is not trendy like buca dear pepi nor like olive garden where you are herded in and out with mediocre food.   This place has authentic Italian food and you get to choose what you want!   So delicious! !  And their staff is by far the best!   We regularly eat here.  Thanks for your piece of Italy! !

OH MY PASTA! I can't boast enough about this place! It really is the best pasta I have had, and I come from a house of Italians and chefs! Every single dish was amazing and the service was great! It's a smaller place, which I actually love - more of a quiet "homey" feel. 

We had 3 different meals:

Spaghetti with meat sauce - DELICIOUS! The meat sauce is extremely hearty and flavorful

Pappardelle with pink diablo sauce - HOLY CRAP. It has just the perfect amount of kick to it and the pasta was perfectly cooked

Spinach ravioli with liguria sauce - BASIL BASIL BASIL! I've never had a pesto sauce more fresh than theirs - we got this dish without chicken to accommodate our vegetarian of the group which was good to know any sauce can be made without meat - all cooked TO ORDER.

Nutella cheesecake for dessert, need I say more?

I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this place to every foodie and pasta lover!

Just had one of the most amazing dinners with my family. Each of us ordered our own pasta, which were super generous in size. We started with the caprese salad, which was so full of flavor. I knew pasta would be amazing. My dad got the spicy pasta with a ton of seafood. That was everyone's favorite of the night. The sauce had so much flavor and there were so much different pieces of seafood. I definitely recommend this one. All the other pastas were great, I got the garlic lovers (4.5) my mom got the chicken parm, which was amazing (5) my brother got the chicken Alfredo, simple but full of flavor (4.5) seriously this place is awesome. And the staff rocks!!!!

The Pasta is really good here. It's tucked away in a semi hidden location in the center back of the shopping center.

Keep in the mind the menu prices, its pick a pasta which costs a few dollars, then pick a sauce that costs a few more dollars.  So you add up the two prices to get your total, unlike most Restaurants with a single price.  

The Restaurant only has a few tables inside, so come early, whether for lunch or dinner.  Overall, the Pasta cooked is perfect, and they do the sauces well. The food quality is tops here, just the menu is a bit confusing.  A good place to go if you're willing to head out to Summerlin area.

I am very picky when it comes to Italian food. Being Italian myself, I thought I couldn't get any better than my moms cooking. After being forced to come here by my parents, I couldn't believe how good it was. I had the butternut squash filled ravioli and it was amazing. I was shocked when I found out that the owners were from Italy and made their own pasta. It really shows in their cooking. This is the only Italian food I actually enjoy eating out. I really hope they get a bigger location in the future! I'll keep coming back regardless.

I love supporting local/family-owned places, and found this spot while browsing the "Hot & New" section of Yelp. I ate here on 12-6-15 and 12-19-15.

My first visit, I had gnocchi with the creamy basil pesto. I love gnocchi so much, I've made it myself at home, and this was good gnocchi (good pesto, too). The portion was generous, and you don't just get garlic bread with the dish--it's also brought out to the table prior to your entree. The garlic bread isn't anything special or out of this world, but it's a nice addition.

My second visit, I had spaghetti with caprese "sauce." (It was much more photogenic than the green gnocchi, but both dishes were absolutely delicious). Again, the portion was very generous, and they boxed up leftovers for me. I had leftovers both times.

It's small on the inside, not a ton of seating, but the service is friendly and fast, and the food is fresh and yummy. I hope they do well--I know I'll be back to support them!

Stopped here on a whim the other day. Honestly my expectations were reserved.  I have eaten alot of really fine Italian food in my life.  The place is quaint, clean and pleasant.  I was greeted by the owner's son who patiently explained their concept snd even offered tge lunch special pricing to me even though it was past the posted time frame.
I ordered rigatoni with arrabiatta sauce and went home.
Man was I surprised!! Take out pasta which was still warm after a 15 minute drive home. The pasta was cooked perfectly and tge sauce was the best I have tasted since keaving NJ 21 years ago. The garlic bread was soft,and warm and delivious when topped with fresh bruschetta. Don't pass on this gem of a restaurant.  
We ordered deliver last night and my entire family enjoyed it.
Eat here please I want this restaurant to thrive!
Excellent pasta. Had the marinara and meatballs, and the carbonara. Both were sublime. Mostly a takeout place, but the prices are quite reasonable.

Not often dish out five star reviews but Pasta Idea was on point from the minute walked in the restaurant. So many five star things that love about this place! First foremost love seeing small business/family own restaurants succeed in Vegas. Pasta Idea is truly one of those spots in life. 

Shout out yelp family for telling me about this great hidden gem in Vegas. As in hidden if your not looking for it probably going pass by it. It depends on the direction coming from on Lake Mead Blvd. I just about passed it myself. Pasta Idea located in tiny shopping mall tucked in the corner next to Cafe Rio. In the same area with bunch of office buildings.

They have daily special board right outside. I came for lunch with another yelper Suzy H. So best things about dining with yelpers get to try lot of food!! It was my first time Suzy H second time got the low down on the menu. The thing Pasta Idea is know for is all there pasta are fresh. FRESH!!!! Sold!! The difference between dry pasta and fresh pasta are worlds apart. Outside of the strip I have not found many italian restaurants that serve lot of fresh pasta. Am sure few do serve some but all the pasta on the menu? The thing is not just your typical common spaghetti, fettuccine, etc. Bigoli, Cavatelli, bunch of different ravioli,and even gluten free fresh pasta. Truly pasta shape for everyone. Sauces. They have bunch that can choose from mix and match with your choice of pasta. Endless possibilities of pasta heaven! They do have lot of set pasta dishes on the menu. Full menu. The appetizers ordered the Prosciutto crude and fresh mozzarella appetizer. Talk about da bomb. The prosciutto was sliced perfect nice thin slices. Really could have order pound of that just go cold cut and be content in life. The mozzarella also amazing. The freshness was on point add drizzle of olive oil and seasoning. It was the perfect starter. I ordered the Bigoli with meat sauce. It was amazing. The Bigoli was cooked to perfection combine with full hearty meat sauce. The portion size is ridiculous. Unlike chain restaurants not only full portion but packed with flavor. I was surprise finish the whole plate but it was that addicting. The price. Steal of deal. Lot of the dishes are under $20 dollars. If looking for something more affordable then going out the strip for great pasta Pasta Idea. The garlic bread with the tomato bruschetta on the side. Easily the best garlic bread had in long time. Not only is the bread hot, seasoning perfect balance not garlic garlic but clearly taste other seasonings, and bread nice toasted crust when pull piece apart yay! 

Pasta Idea is tiny restaurant. Couple tables outside. I do love the art work on the walls. I love the vibe small family run business. No doubt plan on coming back because pasta combinations are endless. Delicious!!
Great little hole in the wall with a killer lunch special.

Ok let me say I have gone at least ten times in the past and loved this place.  My wife and I went last night and sat at the little counter by the bathroom.  Not the most appetizing spot but we were ok with it.  They literally had 6 tables with us (1 big combined table) and 3 waitresses.  No one talked or looked at us for 15 minutes.  No menu, nothing.  Young kid came over and said it was his first Saturday shift and apologized.  No problem!  He took our order immediately, still no menus, but we knew what we wanted.  Brought us drinks and free garlic bread.  Fast forward one hour later still no food.  Remember 6 tables and 3 servers.  2 tables had come in after us and were DONE eating.  I finally said something and server said it will be right out.  5 minutes later another server comes out and told me they had no more gnocchi left, do I want to order something else.  I was furious told them no and wanted to talk to the manager.  They said the owner is out in the kitchen and he will be right out to explain.  Waited 3 minutes staring at owner and he never came out.  Left and will never go back.  Just read post about new owner and that explains everything.  That sucks cause this was my favorite pasta.  It will be closed in one year, damn.  44 years old and I have never written a negative review, so disappointed.

Amazing find!  Fresh and tasty!  Warm bread to start.  The House Salad was a meal in and of itself!  The Red Diablo sauce on the bigoli noodles was absolutely authentic and very, very delicious!  A real gem!  The service was awesome as well.  Only here for a few days, but we know where to go for authentic Italian the next time we are in town!

THIS IS AMAZING!!!! 
Best pasta I have ever had! 
I especially loved the chicken marsala. (however everything was really good)
The staff is incredible. Very very attentive. 
The lasagna is a hot item get it while they have it. Gluten free noodles are available as well. The pasta is cooked to perfection, I love everything about this place mostly because the food is so good. :D 
I highly recommend !

This place is awesome! The pasta is homemade and perfectly al dente everytime. The sauces are homemade and whether it's a white wine, a creamy white or red sauce it's fantastic. The service is also fantastic. Our server Carrie is always energetic and knowledgeable with recommendations and a great attitude. Definitely a terrific place and the price is absolutely right. Congratulations on such a unique restaurant and very excited for the future of the business. Can't wait to return.

this is about a very key member of your team...as i have not had the pleasure of enjoying your pasta, but will this week........
wantt to compliment one of your staff. 
 i am an uber driver.  
picked up this young man and took him and his friend downtown last night.  
we got to chatting and i asked him what he does....and he was so very proud to tell me about pasta idea, which is a place i have on my list but not yet visited.  
this young man is all about customer service on and off the clock.  i praised him for that.  

he could not stop complimenting the chef and the skills the chef has and how much the chef enjoys cooking for his customers.  this young man had me wanting to turn around to come to your restaurant at that moment....i will be there in the coming weeks for sure....

want you to know that i personally feel that you are so very blessed to have such an energetic young man on your team.  he is golden for you and your team.  

i think that we all know it is so rare these days to find someone to hire that meets ones expectation, much less exceeds them as this young man obviously does.  i did not catch his name, but he is a taller thin young man.  you and your store are very very blessed to have him inside and outside of your doors.  i look forward to my first meal at pasta idea

Ok, can't express enough of my frustration and anger towards this restaurant. First, the night before I order a couple of pasta dinner and a dessert and had the lady repeat my order, then my wife came back with a soup instead of dessert and was charged for it, and today, again i order spaghetti and specialty pasta (baked butternut squash ravioli) got home to find out that they gave me Rigatoni w some red sauce,and what irritated me the most is that I gave the guy a tip for making sure that I have the right order this time (of course I didn't checked because its tightly tied in the bag already) but how incompetent your staff could be!the first time, I could let it by, simple mistake right but second time in a row! Come on now! Driving 22mls to your restaurant twice to hopefully enjoy the pasta I was craving and you messing it up twice! 
WARNING for patrons:
Make sure to visually check your pick up order before leaving, therefore you'll avoid disappointment when you get home
Update:
After expressing the issue with Carrie she immediately offer a full refund on the item that was missing and I said no need for refund but she offers an invite to make up if I'm willing to come back which I did along with my family. This time no disappointment and she was very accommodating to us and we had the pasta that I had been craving. I was solved!
Important note: this is still my go to place for pasta fix, incredibly good spaghetti, fresh taste and very reasonably priced. 
Again, thank you for making the best pasta in my town!

Food was good.  But I really didn't understand how it could cost as much as if did.  I'm sorry but paying $5.95 for noodles and then $7.70 for the sauce to go into of it?  Why not just fully disclose the whole price combined?

This place is a hidden gem. I ordered through the app so there was a shortl wait when I got there because of a glitch in technology. I ordered the cypress Salad, pasta with garlic, and linguini  with Alfredo sauce. The salad was super tasty. Very fresh mozzarella , it was delicious. The garlic lovers pasta was light and full of flavor. The Alfredo linguini pasta was the best I've ever had. The portion size was a two meal size. Definitely worth every penny. I will visit them again. So many delicious choices.
Perfection! Away from the strip...friendly in a sweet Italian way and the food was to die for. Lots of choices made it hard to decide! Incredible service and kindness!

4th time here in 3 weeks! Love is an understatement I have for pasta, haha. Luckily my friend is a yelp elite and she showed me this place. I owe her my life now HAHA! But seriously everything is so good. I've had the carbonara with pappardelle, gnocchi with basil pesto and Gorgonzola, and simple fettuccine with 5 cheese sauce. Today I got the Brie cream sauce with shrimp, tomato and asparagus with fettuccine. (It's called the gnocchi special but I substituted the noodle) SO GOOD. It's a small place, so I'm not sure I'd have a bunch of people come at once. If it was closer to me I'd get it delivered everyday.

MUST TRY! Spent the weekend in Vegas & was craving pasta the whole time but so glad to have waited till the last day to come across this yummy delicious family owned eatery. The pasta is amazing also got the meatballs as an appetizer and WOW the whole experience was amazing. Thank you Pastaidea :)

I have been wanting to try this place for a while and it did NOT disappoint! The location is small and cozy which I love. It's so hard sometimes to find mom and pop shop style restaurants here in Vegas that it's exciting when you find one that's REALLY good. They have a big variety of pastas and sauces. I had the the fettuccine Alfredo and you could defiantly tell that the pasta was homemade and the sauce was creamy, delicious, and flavorful. I will definitely be coming back to try out their different pastas and sauces. The customer service was outstanding! I was greeted by two people as soon as I walked in.The gentleman that helped me explained the menu and told me about all the different options. He was patient with me while I chose what I wanted. I ordered to go and the food was ready in about 10 minutes. The portion was good for the price definitely something two people could share. *Bonus you get warm garlic bread!
See again soon Pastaidea!

Tried this place tonight for the first time! I usually go to Mac Shack but after eating here tonight I will definitely be back! Lots of options for sauce and noodles, big portions and very cute place with really nice staff.

This place is amazing! A friend of mine recommended it since I've been trying to find a good pasta place and this definitely hit the spot. I went w a few of my girlfriends and we all got completely different platters and all of the were amazing. I got the mushroom stuffed ravioli w carbonara sauce and it was delicious. Definitely a heavy duo but if you don't mind, it was amazing. The place was quite small but I called and made reservations and we were fine!

first time here today and it was a great experience.  who could up fresh pasta?!  build your own pasta dish, they also offer specials of the day.  the portions are pretty big, you'll probably leave with leftovers.  and not to mention the friendly staff.  

definitely recommend checking this place out.

This pasta shop ONLY got three stars because of their cleanliness and customer service was awesome. 

The food was so tasteless; I couldn't even finish it. I ordered pasta with meat sauce because the cashier told me it was her favorite. So I thought to myself, 'Huh, meat sauce is a good place to start. It's tomatoes, meat, and seasoning, so it can't taste bad.' 

Wrong. So wrong. 

The meat sauce had no flavorful herbs; it BARELY tasted like salt and a passing breeze of one pungent herb that is simply indescribable. The sauce had almost no meat, and was so watered down that I couldn't even taste the tomatoes. 

The noodles were fresh, yes, but again, there was no flavor to help them along in the meal. 

My bread was burnt on one side, tasted mostly like butter (a twinge of garlic flavor). The best thing about the entire meal were the tomatoes in the bruschetta. The topping itself tasted sour, but the sweetness of the tomatoes saved it. 

I would've rather spent my $12 at Olive Garden.

needless to say; I won't be coming back.

I love that this small business opened up. The owners are so sweet and always make sure the guests are happy. I've been here twice and loved everything I've had. Their spicy Diablo pasta is one of the best pastas I've had...ever. Their specials are also great. I will definitely keep coming back!

I love Pastaidea!! Been here a few times and everything has always been great! The staff is super nice and the food is absolutely delicious!! 

Ordered online this time via my mobile phone and it was really easy to navigate and process my order. There isn't any details about the sauces when you order online so have the menu pulled on on yelp for guidance. Two things about the online ordering is that when I ordered online it said my order would be available at :25. I arrived at :26 but didn't leave until :45. Not a huge deal but maybe if you're pressed for time better to call ahead to make sure it's ready!! Also in the "special instruction" section I requested mushrooms and it looks like it didn't process to them. Minor flaws in the online ordering method.

I advised Juan about the wait time and he was really understanding and so incredibly nice!! 

*ordered Pappardelle w/ Carbonara
Great fresh past.  The chicken cacciatore is great and my go to dish.  Tortellini and Ravioli are also great.

This place is amazing.... Always excellent food and the guy running the place is incredibly nice and friendly! I will be taking all of my out of town visitors here! We just moved to Vegas last month and we have been here once a week. Love it!

This was a good experience, the driver was very nice and friendly and was 10 minutes early!! 

I ordered the spaghetti and meatball and a capese salad which was delicious!! Definitely ordering from here again.

On recommendation from others, I decided to give this place a try tonight.

Well away from the strip, this is a small shop with 4 (or 5?) tables inside and a couple outside.

I ordered one of their new specials tonight - Linguine black ink squid on seafood sauce with calamari, ahi tuna, shrimp, scallops, sole fillet.

They brought out some garlic bread to start, but I barely had time to sample it (it was good) before my pasta came out.

As they described when I ordered it, it has a strong seafood taste, which, since I like seafood, added to the dish.

Adding to the food, the service was excellent, and shows they care about everything.

Dish and drink being just over $20 (before tip), and it was worth every penny.

What a great new find!!!!!!!!
We had the chicken tortellini soup and a pan fried chicken 
breast sandwich.
    The soup was homemade in house and had 
a lot of multi-colored tortellini, plenty of chicken and veggies, but best of all, it had lots of flavor.
    The sandwich was a chicken breast pan fried to a golden brown.
It came with arugula,tomatoes,onions, pepperoncini, and a great citrus dressing. Definitely one of those sandwiches I will crave from time to time!!!!!!!!!!!! Our waitress was even kind enough to bring us a side of marinara and pesto sauces to dip our sandwich into.
    Everyone that works here was super friendly and we definitely will be back. I just wish they had another location on the south side of town.

Second visit still my favorite Italian food that I didn't have to cook!   I got the chicken parm and upgraded the side.  And it was worth it.  And just so u know there two cannoli in one order. But I ate every bit. Wife got the tricolor tortellini w cream sauce. We ended up sharing all of it.

Pastaidea is good and it's definitely on its way to being great. However, they have some kinks they need to work out. 

I arrived Monday evening and approached the counter to order to-go. There was only 1 other couple dining in so I was approached quickly by the staff. I felt a little rushed to order as it was my first time but they were really friendly. I ended up choosing the cheese tortellini with pink sauce, asparagus, mushrooms, grape tomatoes and chicken then a nutella cheesecake for dessert. 

The wait was short and i was on my way home with fresh, hot food in about 20 minutes. 

When i finally opened the bag up i found the sauce leaked out of the paper container the pasta was in and I was missing my cheesecake! It was frustrating to clean up the meal prior to eating and I live too far away to bother returning for my cheesecake. 

The food i did eat was great - flavorful and large amount that i'll be eating throughout the week.
