Despite the kinks and paying for something i didn't receive, the food is worth returning for. I'll just be sure to take extra precautions from now on.

My girlfriend is a New York Italian and grew up on home made pastas. This is the best either of us has ever had! Incredible food, very generous portions, and exceptionally reasonable pricing make this place a must try. We'll be coming back here every time we're in Vegas.

Very friendly staff. Big potions. Nice presentation.  Tasty spring mix salad. Absolutely delicious mushroom ravioli! Less one star for no ranch dressing (I know, it's Italian, but still, not everyone likes vinegar based dressings) and the tiramisu was frozen. We will definitely eat there again!

Went on Google maos....and found this place as we were on vacation in Las Vegas. ..

Fairly new place,  pleasant polite staff.
Food was really good and filling.

Definitely would go back here....

So if your traveling through check this place out.....

Had lunch here as I was in town for work, cute little shop and I felt welcomed as soon as I walked in. They really took care of me, greeted me and had a Sprite in my hands before I had time to think. I asked what the meat sauce was like and they gave me a sample of it to try it before ordering. I ended up ordering the spaghetti and meat sauce, it was excellent. I will be going back as this was a very positive experience and great food.
This was so worth the drive off the strip!!! The gluten free fettuccine was off the charts! Loved the atmosphere. The restaurant was so clean and the service was fantastic!
Tiny little place tucked in back. The ravioli's were delicious. Service was excellent. A bit pricey for the ambiance. Felt like a fast food chain.

Holy ravioli! This place is G.O.O.D. In my family, comfort food = pasta; we eat it at least 3 times a week, and have a make-your -own-ravioli party every Christmas. This is by far the best pasta restaurant we have come across. A couple of tips:
1) Get it to go! The restaurant is small and every time I've been there it's had a weird smell, almost like a sewer problem.
2) Skip dessert - their chocolate cake looks tempting, but when I tried it I was disappointed that it was pretty dry and had that refrigerator taste to it. Oh well, that just means you have more room for pasta! 
Pasta Idea has become a new staple for my family whenever we're in town. New York has the pizza, but Las Vegas has the pasta!

This place is a hidden gem that satisfies my Italian urges. Cooked with love like a fiery Italian nona would prepare for her family. Why pay twice the price for on strip mediocrity when you can get quality fresh pasta right here in your own backyard

If you like good authentic Italian this is place. I would hurry up and eat here before they become known because this is probably one of the top Italian eats in town. The food and service is phenomenal. This is coming from an Italian snob. Small dining room but worth every bit and the prices are very reasonable.

I had the Arrabbiata sauce with the thick spaghetti and it was delicious. However, this place gave me the worst case of food poisoning I've ever experienced. Half an hour after finishing the meal I got the worst stomach cramps and threw up several times. It was accompanied by the other fun symptoms of food poisoning and I was out for 3 days. I even had a fever the second day. As amazing as it tasted I think won't be returning. It will be a while until I will have pasta again, the sight of it makes me a bit queasy right now.

Tried it for the first time tonight. It was really good. We got the pappadelle noodles with vodka sauce. The creamy sauce had a lot of flavor and the pasta was tender and cooked perfectly. The two ladies helping customers were knowledgeable and efficient. We ordered take out and it took about 15 minutes because it was freshly prepared. We will absolutely be back.

I am an Italian originally from Northern NJ so my pasta standards are pretty high. I have ordered from Pasta Idea many times and they never disappoint. The food and service is outstanding. I definitely recommend this place to anybody looking for a good meal.

Wow home made pasta I had the Parpadelle 
Pasta with meat sauce . Outstanding can't wait to try the other dishes on the menu very impressed with the home made Pasta sauce if you get a chance give this place a shot that's how they stay open

Pasta Idea is always a great place!!! The staff is amazingly friendly and speedy. The food is delicious as always and keeps me coming back every time. Highly recommend. Best place for lunch and they also have delicious desert. :) thanks pasta idea for keeping up your amazing culture and always providing great service

Absolutely great food ! The smell when you walk in is great .... like the Italian Home kitchen ! 
Employees are super pleasant . Portions are great for the price too .

Although the carbonara & red diablo tasted good, they were definitely a step down from the perfect flavors made by the previous chef of this restaurant. My friend noticed that the pasta was not as "fresh" like before.

Super disappointed with this place. I got the butternut squash ravioli with Carbonara. $17 and I got EIGHT raviolis. I wasn't crazy about the flavor and it was way to greasy. Definitely won't be coming back.

The pasta is great. It's a little tight inside and they get busy, but that's forgiven because it's so good.  We've been here several times, gotten different dishes each time - all always good, especially the pink vodka sauce.
The food was fabulous. Many different options on noodles and toppings. Great lunch spot in a quiet little nook. The service was friendly too. Homemade noodles, yum!!

There are many Italian restaurants in the valley but few that have a born-and-raised there owner. It was nice reminiscing in a language I grew up with and despite the uncertain as to "what to do" wait staff (I'm sure he'll grow into it within weeks. Seems like a sharp kid.) and the lack of two of my favorite noodles (penne and vermicelli ) , Pasta Mia, small and quaint, is a welcome addition to the neighborhood. I saw the antipasto plate on the next table over and almost shouted "Bravissimo!". I am told their meatballs are truly scrumptious as well. I will definitely be going back la prossimo volta. Bon Appetito! I had the carbonara and it was terrific. Huge portion and took half home with me. Just as good a day later. I'm hoping to give them 5 stars because I am really in their corner and wish them the greatest success.

Found them through a Yelp search while looking for someplace new to try out. They deliver on their promise of fresh and homemade pasta daily. Had the lasagna and was impressed. Reminded me of dinners in Italy. You won't be disappointed.

FANTASTIC! As a Jersey Italian and a cook myself I will vouch for how awesome this place is. I've been many times ordering something new each time and I've never been disappointed. You can tell the pasta is made fresh and the flavors are always right on point.

I was excited to try this place a few months ago and saw they deliver (I live in desert shores) so it's right down the street. I called to order and the man was very very rude. 
I asked him for simple spaghetti and he said they didn't have any. I asked for a few more things and they didn't have those pasta/sauces either. 

My friend and I looked at each other and laughed. What a joke! How can you be a pasta restaurant and run out of SPAGHETTI. 
At least go to smiths and get some spaghetti to keep your restaurant going. Unforgivable.

My girlfriend and I decided to check this place out today, even though it was kind of busy I received excellent service from Kyle. The food was amazing, hands down the best pasta place I've been to in Las Vegas. I will definitely eat here more often!

Absolutely great pasta place. Had the seafood ciopino with crab, mussels, clams, and fish over fettuccini noodles. Only 5 tables in this small pasta shop so there is a wait for a table sometimes but the wait is worth it

So yummy! Not a bad thing to say about anything we tried. Had spaghetti and meatballs, chicken parm, garlic lovers, Mac n cheese with pancetta and mushrooms. Everything tasted very fresh and homemade. The garlic bread and bruschetta was so good too. The portions were huge, had enough for a meal the next day. Only downside is the size of the place, hope they can expand soon. Will definitely be back to the try the vodka sauce, butternut squash ravioli and the gnocchi.

I feel bad that I have to remove some stars from my review...but maybe they had an off day.  The female server spoke English as a second language so communication was non-existent.  She was so inattentive that a couple, that sat on a table next to me, left furiously because they weren't greeted, at all.  

The worst part of my experience was the food.  I've been here 3 times, prior, and the chicken was fresh and grilled.  This visit...the chicken was disgusting.  It seemed like scrap pieces that they forgot to throw away...fatty, yellow, chewy, absolutely gross.  The chicken seemed as if it was boiled, previously, then heated up in the microwave so that the pieces were all rubbery.  I couldn't eat any of the pasta...I got,  completely, turned off!

The ice tea was good!  I'm really sad to be so disappointed by Pasta Idea...when it was becoming my fave place!  :(

This is my first time in this lovely little place. Pastaidea has excellent pasta I got the bigoli pasta and it was terrific with the marinara sauce it was a very decent & good portion. And then I was surprised by getting pretty much what is a bruschetta. I highly recommend this place. A great ittle hole-in-the-wall great food great people here.

Absolutley delicious!! Im a big fan of italian food and tend to grade italian joints pretty hard but this place is great. I came here after seeing a spotlight on them from yelp. Place is very tiny no room to really sit so at first i was thrown off. I ordered a few things to go mostly a couple of ordinary items and i decided to try one special item which ended up being the best. Now this is a pasta place so dont come in here if your looking for chicken parm or veal but the pasta speaks for itself. Everything comes with a slice of garlic bread which is nice because bread always pairs well with pasta. I tried four different types of pastas and found a seafood one to be my favorite. Everything was great though and the portions are huge took me several days to polish off what i had gotten. I suggest this place to anyone looking for good takeout italian just dont expect to find a seat they need a bigger space this place could do wonders with the quality they are offering just need to relocate.

Drive past Buca di Beppo and come to Pastaidea! The food is delish, the choices are plentiful, and the portions are huge. I had the gluten free pasta and it tasted as good as any gluten loaded pasta I've ever had.

I'm not gonna lie I use Yelp to always find good places but am usually to lazy to leave a review myself. This place was sooooo good I felt the need to make the effort! I ordered delivery and got the rigatoni with garlic lovers sauce, side salad and meatball appetizer. The pasta was absolutely amazing! And I was VERY impressed with the salad. I'm so used to getting some old lettuce and a tomato when I get a side salad but this was full of fresh ingredients spring mix, fresh tomatoes, huge chunks of cheese, roasted peppers, olives, and was enough for at least 2 people! Meatballs I'm always super picky. They weren't the best I've ever had, but they were good. Overall I'm bummed i ordered when I was housesitting cause I'm too far away to get delivery where I live  but for anyone that lives in this area I doubt you'll find a better place!!
Just opened today and the food is fresh and authentic. The hospitality was great and we even got some free samples which were also great! Hope they keep up the quality

I had a craving for linguine and clams one day, so a friend and I traveled here from across town. As usual, this place rocked.

The clams were small, but they give you a huge portion. Easily two fistfuls. The sauce had just the right amount of garlic, and the taste of the clams really came through in spite of the amount of parsley and garlic. Really, a simply incredible rendition of a classic Italian dish. The only adjustment I'd prefer is a slightly thicker sauce.

The ambiance is perfect for lunch, and the service was exceptional. I wish I could remember his name. A very tall, young guy who knew the menu well and provided just the right amount of attention to the table.

See you again soon, Pasta Idea!

My husband and I wanted to try a "new place " for dinner. Found Pasta Idea read the reviews decided to give it a go. We were not disappointed at all. I love the idea of picking your pasta and your own sauce  combo.  I ended up getting the Meat Lasagna  (AMAZING) my husband ordered the spinach ravioli with the Diablo sauce. Great as well. 
This place is small and set back in the corner of the center. Not easy to find if you dont know it is there. But so worth looking for it. 
The staff was so friendly. We will be for sure going back

The food was really good! The pasta was fresh and the sauces were delicious. We ordered a variety of dishes ranging from seafood, chicken and meatballs in various white and red sauces. They were all very good!!! The meatballs in the spaghetti was flavorful as well as the white wine sauce with clams. We live in southern highlands so the drive is pretty long but we will keep going back and would highly recommend! The staff were so friendly, the service was excellent! We didn't wait that long for  our food, maybe because there weren't that many people. But there were 9 people in our party, kids included so that's pretty good. We were there on Sunday evening, so maybe that's their down time...not sure. We love this place! Will be coming back for sure!
Always amazing!! And everytime you come back your immediately reminded why ... Its that good :). RECOMMEND!!! Anything on the menu.. You can't go wrong! Also great lunch specials ;)

Havent tried the food yet, waiting on it as I write this but the customer service was terrible. I walk up to the counter and start speaking and the older blonde lady rudely interrupts me as I'm trying to ask a question (being a first time guest) I'd like to ask how things work, so she says the other lady will be right with me. So I wait, and wait and the other lady steps to the counter and asks what I want and I tell her. She said that they were busy which there's 7 tables literally in the entire restaurant and people at 5 of the 7. I work at a restaurant and know what busy is and this was not it. So I sit at a vacant table as I wait for my food to go and the older blonde lady brings food from other tables to the vacant table I'm sitting at to box for her leaving customers and literally scrapes the food into the boxes in my face, I'm surprised she didn't get any of their half eaten food on me as a sat there. Literally the worst customer service. Good luck going here.

I just got here but am rating it 5 stars. Why? Because the service is great and all I've had to eat so far is the complimentary bread and it too was great. I don't even like raw tomatoes,  but I cleaned my plate. I'm coming back!

I ordered lunch on a rainy day and they did not disappoint! 

I ordered the pesto with chicken dish with pappelle noodles and then a kids portion spaghetti and meatballs.  

I first tried the pesto dish and at first bite it didn't taste like much.  Second bite, I scooped up more sauce and got a piece of chicken, yum!  Third bite, this is good in my book! 

Ok on to the meatballs... it was a little tough to cut with the plastic fork so I just bit into it.  Ohh, it's meaty.  Got some noodles with sauce, oh yea, that's what it's about!  The mariana sauce is bold and flavorful, it packed a good punch.  The spaghetti was cooked perfectly.  Oh and the kids portion is huge!  It could feed my nephew and me! 

Needless to say I had tons of left overs.  I can't wait to try the other dishes here.

So this is a little hole in the wall restaurant. It's not very spacious at all and the decor isn't exactly welcoming. However, if you're looking for highly priced take out, this is it! They do deliveries also. Now, don't get me wrong, Pasta Idea has some pretty good eats but it's not the kind of place you bring your family to if you're on a budget. It's quite expensive for a place like this, but the food is tasty (I'm a sucker for garlic bread & I loved theirs)! I had bigoli pasta with the pink diablo sauce. It was very good - although I'll probably get something less spicy next time. The lasagna was on their "favorites" menu, but I've had better. It was mostly pasta and very minimal meat sauce. The meat sauce is tasty, though, I must admit. If you feel like splurging on a meal one day, by all means check this place out. But if you're looking for food on a budget, pasta idea is not for you.

Our family was visiting from CA and we decided to take them here.  Since this place is so small and we were 6 people  I called and made a reservation.  They have some new things on the menu since the last time we visited the last time.  They serve garlic bread with bruschetta and were happy to give us an additional order when we asked.  We ordered the Prosciutto Crudo and Fresh Mozzarella Appetizer which was delicious.  The portion was enough for 5 of us to share, the prosciutto was exceptional and the cost was very reasonable at $11.45.  We ordered a variety of dishes, Amatriciana (spicy marinara with mixed Italian meats), clams in white wine with angel hair pasta, tricolor cheese tortellini, chicken piccata also with angel hair and ossobucco  which was one of the  specials.  All of our dishes were fantastic and although I did not order the chicken piccata I had the leftovers and it was one of the best I have had.  Every time we visit here we are very happy with the food and the wait staff that are very friendly and helpful.

Hey Out of Towners! If you are going to Las Vegas and looking for a truly wonderful homemade Italian meal (off of the Vegas Strip), this is THE PLACE to go! It's a great little 'hole in the wall!' nestled in the corner of a strip mall.  Pasta Idea is not fancy, but clean and bright.  There are maybe 8 tables for seating.  The owner is an Italian chef and he and his family are very kind and accommodating. Everything is fresh and make to order.  The Caprese salad was spectacular. with fresh, firm beef steak tomatoes, wonderful mozzarella cheese, mixed greens and a flavorful balsamic; easily big enough to serve 2 of us.  I loved the chicken piccata. When you order, you get to choose the kind of pasta you want with your dish (all the pasta is freshly made). There is a a separate charge for each pasta choice which was a little confusing when we saw the bill.  All and all, this place is well worth a visit and the prices are very reasonable.
The best Italian food I have ever had and you will ever have. Drops the mic and walks off to finish eating.

If you are looking for fresh pasta made from fresh ingredients and great sauce, this is the place. The food was hot and delicious. The staff was friendly and helpful. All the pasta is made fresh daily on premises. 
We started out with complementary garlic bread with a bruschetta mix. I had the ravioli and had them mix half Cheese, half cheese with the four cheese white sauce. The whole meal was a delightful surprise of fresh ingredients and great flavor. It came out so hot I had to blow on it before eating it and the portion was more than I can could finish. 

It is a small shop, about 12 seats indoors. So order takeout if you must, but I'd try to get a seat to get it fresh and hot. 

I'll come back to Pasta Idea again and again.

This Place Did Not Dissapoint. The carbonara was on point with perfectly cooked parpadelle. I really liked the complimentary garlic bread with heirloom  tomato bruschetta. I highly suggest this place if you are in the mood for very good pasta in a casual and friendly setting.

Great little place with terrific food.  Caprese salad was as large as I've had anywhere and good! I knew it was going to be good when I heard the chef pounding the veal and chicken in the kitchen. Veal Saltimbocca and Chicken Parmigiana were both outstanding. We were starving so we tried the meatball appetizer as well.  Took half of each meal home. Also an outstanding variety of pastas available. The Gnocchi are next on the list. There were also nearly a line for take-out orders as well while we dined in.

Friends of my wife told us of this place so we decided to give it a try. When we got there it was not crowded so we grabbed a table. Looked at the menu and knew what we wanted. So we waited for someone to take our order. About a 10 to 15 minute wait. My wife said if no one comes in a few minutes we would leave. Finally the waitress came over and took our order. Two waters and two drinks. She left and came back with some bread ( three slices for two people ! ) it was not crisp but very soggy. She came back with the waters and one drink and had to go back for the other. While we were waiting for our food we watched what was going on. The waitress messed up the order on the table next to us, and the other person working there came over to our table with someone else's order. This happened a few more times with others orders. It was like they could not remember who got what. Got our food finally, wife got the  Bigoli noodles with meat sauce which she said noodles were a little chewy and sauce not tasty. I got the regular noodles with meat sauce and meat balls, noodles a little chewy and sauce seemed ok but different then the meat sauce my wife got. Meatballs were small and not very tasty. Food was not very hot when served to us.
So we tried it and will not got back because of service, taste and price. All items are al carte which adds up. 
We will stick going to Mezzo Bistro which is about same price or cheaper and the meatballs are the size of a baseball and has good service and larger tables.

Passing through Vegas, we new we wanted Italian but off the strip. Soooooo Good!!!! They make their own noodles and sauces daily. The macaroni with mushrooms and pancetta was magical! I wish that I lived closer because they deliver! Very friendly staff!

Recently ordered through Yelp Eat 24 and was extremely impressed. Had four unique pasta dishes to share with my roommates and all were amazingly fresh and flavorful. The ravioli and tortellini were highlights, but the Diablo Sauce was the true show stopper ( red or pink, both unreal ). If you're looking for great handmade fresh pasta, look no further!

Stopped in with my girlfriend for the first time to try their lunch specials. I didn't think the quality of the food matched the price, even for the lunch special. We both agreed it wouldn't be worth it to return.

Delicious and fresh! The menu setup is a bit different since they charge separately for pasta selection and sauce/topping selection, so the pasta dishes end up averaging $15-$18 but it is well worth it and they serve yummy and fresh garlic bread.  I hope eventually they expand their restaurant- it is a tiny little place that will fill easily.. Kind of gives an eat&go feel. Next time we might just pick up.

So happy my Mother told me about this place. Truly the cutest whole in the wall. 

My family and I decided to come eat here and see what my mother was raving about. The place is very small with very limited table seating.
Lucky for us when we arrived there was a table available. 

You start off with your choice of pasta then pick your sauce. Or you can get one of their specialties pastas. 
First they bring out this amazing garlic butter toast bread with a pesto sauce of some sort to dip in. 
I had two entrees because I couldn't choose between the mushroom Ravioli and Spaghetti with Red Diablo sauce. Also because I'm a fat ass.
Anyways, both pastas were delicious but the spaghetti with Diablo sauce was the winner.
Sauce was spicy, savory and delicious. 
My Mother had the Chicken Parmesan. 
Niece loved the Shrimp fettuccini Alfredo. 
And my Father had the #38, Shrimp and Scallops Fra Diavolo. 

The owner and young lady working were both  super sweet. Very attentive on making sure we didn't need anything. My parents loved it so much they're already talking about going back.
I highly recommend it if you're in the area.
Really good pasta it's homemade and you could choose what type of sauce you'd like, also they give big portions

Very good pasta! Delicious to eat and beautiful presentation. All straightforward, clean ingredients, generous servings and very friendly staff and actual Italian owners and cooks. 8 weeks in business and I hope they have many good years. Rich menu - incl. gluten free. Alcohol license is pending. Byo!
Stop in on s business Saturdy. Forgot to take a picture of our food. But FANTASTIC! I had the mushroom ravioli and Trentino sauce (speck, mushroom,  peas, white sauce). Will definitely be back

Finally!

I and and a family member have been waiting 15 years to find spaghetti bolognese (with meat sauce) this fabulous.  I didn't dine in, but had leftovers the minute they came in the door. It was nothing like the 'pasta soup' I so often receive, but just as pasta should be.  The sauce stuck to the pasta, with plenty of meat in the dish.  It was not your usual bowl of tomato paste or sauce, but meat sauce and pasta "married" so to speak.  It was ordered, "dry, not watery" but I don't know if it was prepared any differently because of that. Cannot wait to try their porcini mushroom white cream sauce with fettucini.....or perhaps the specialty, bigoli.  An FYI, I'm told the space is very small, with few seats.  Bet they'll be expanding! This dish was superb.

Decided to go to Pastaidea after a Italian neighbor of mine had raved about the good food and after reading many good reviews on Yelp. 
So..... I agree with my neighbor and yelp! Is was delicious! 
I had the chicken Parmesan... it was wonderful... thick juicy chicken and the spaghetti and marinara served with it was delicious! 
The garlic toast was great.... loved the green dipping source ( sorry I don't remember the name of it) 
The Chef/owners son waited on me and was very helpful and informative being I had mentioned this was my first time here. 
Overall great food, great service, everything was homemade... loved it I'll be back!

Great little spot for pasta. Cooked fresh to order and with fresh ingredients and pasta, it's a better value than Olive Garden. The owner was very nice and gave me a coupon for next time. I'll be back to try their other sauces and pastas
high quality ingredients, very good food, okay service, kind of expensive

Love the simple concept homemade pasta is so much better then box stuff.
Everything is tasty and delicious. Very small place so call ahead to make sure their is seating although I've never had a problem.

I can't believe how good the food and service is. We had enough for lunch tomorrow, we're not big eaters and the portions were huge. There were a lot of carry-out orders. The restaurant is pretty small-6 tables- and 5 tables had customers. You will not be disappointed.

My family will only go to Olive Garden for Italian food, because you get the best bang for your buck there. Unlimited amounts of breadsticks, soup, and salad, and you're too full by the time you get your entree so you just take it to go. Yup, we've all been there. Anyhow, I came up with this "idea," (hah) that we try a different Italian place where they handcraft their own noodles, and I convinced them that it would be a lot better than Olive Garden. Sooo, we ended up coming to Pasta Idea about a month, and sadly, they were not convinced. At least I got them to try a place other than Olive Garden haha. 

They strictly serve pasta here. No fried foods/appetizers so ya'll gonna have to get your calamari fix elsewhere. The four of us shared a cioppino, the pink diablo, lasagne, and a chicken alfredo, all with spaghetti pasta. They don't have linguine, but their spaghetti is similar to linguine. Portions are pretty generous. The pink diablo sauce was definitely the highlight with its smokey and spicy flavors. I would ask for less pepperoncini next time though, because it kind of overpowered the flavor of the pasta. Cioppino was pretty good along with the chicken alfredo. All the pasta was a little chewier than I would have liked, and the lasagne was ok, not the best that I've had. However, because they offer so many options, I am willing to give them another try. Service was great. The ladies (possibly the owners) serving us were very cordial.

Ordered delivery and although the wait was slightly longer than I had hoped for... the wait was WORTH IT!! By far the best alfredo sauce I've ever had! The portion sizes were very generous for the price and came with garlic bread and bruschetta... will definitely be ordering again!

Prosciutto crudo and fresh mozzrella was really good! On the plate with proscuitto and cheeses you are also getting nice amount of spring mix.
The plase was better than I expected!!!
On Vacation. My family and I love pasta and this place is amazing! Great good and great service! GO HERE

never made it past your logo on the web page to order :(
I am on to the next place sorry.
I was at Cyndy's party and I have to say, the best pasta ever. The gnocchi was delicious! The antipasto fantastic. So fabulous of Pasta Idea to come to our rescue. I'd go there anytime.

This place is awesome. Some of my wife's friends had told her about it. We had been meaning to go for a while. Finally went last night. This is not a chain. This is a one off location owned by a guy who just came over from Italy. He hand makes his pasta each day. That's why everyone is raving over it. I don't even know what to say other than it was AMAZING. The service was great. Our server was super friendly. We were there until they closed. So she went home and the owner closed us out. Cool guy. A little hard to understand him actually because he still has a super strong accent and his English isn't so great. 

This place will be in our regular rotation of places to eat for sure. 

And yes the portions are good size (not huge though) and yeah the seating options are limited. Oh well. Some of the best places I've ever eaten were small cramped places.

Portion sizes incredible.  Pasta fresh.  Tons of variety of sauces and pastas with variety of spicy levels offered,  Not the healthiest as there's not many greens to add in, but certainly hearty.  This meal will be worth 2 meals in your day for sure.  They deliver, service is fast, and they offer a cute venue on near Lake Mead and Buffalo.  Easy concept, great meal.  Give Pasta Idea a try if you're hungry and want some great pasta that'll last you for days.

The family atmosphere is a good start to saying this is homemade food. I will have one complaint... Today the air conditioning was out and bathroom...just happened to see an earlier review about this location that addressed it.... Peoples.... Its about the FOOD... Ironically I was contacted by Bucca Di Beppo earlier today ( see that review).....The food is fresh flavorful from the bread to the soups to the main courses... I cannot afford to gain another 40 lbs so bettrr have no dessert. I had the baked mushroom Ravioli and sampled garliclover shrimp alfredo lasagna mac n cheese and gnochi... I found all to be worth additional visits.....

Yummy little pasta spot!!

I had the cheese raviolis in vodka sauce and it was light, fresh and flavorful!  I would definitely come back!

Great Restaurant with amazing food .
They offer delivery with EAT24 and GrubHub ...
The food was delivered extremely fast on 9 miles from the restaurant !
Definitely will   Order again !!
Thanks Pasta Idea

Omg! Best flavors and service ever! Their vodka sauce is amazing! I would easily be here every single day if I wasn't worried about all the carbs LOL I absolutely love this place more than I could put into words! If you love pasta this is the place! Hidden gem in the corner, don't miss out! I pray this place is around for years to come!

What a hidden gem! Service was super friendly and accommodating and food was great! Portions are HUGE and they are really generous with garlic bread and drink refills. Garlic bread is really good by the way. 

They offer many varieties of fresh made pasta and let you pick the sauce you want. There are about 40 sauces to pick from. They can even customize. For example, I wanted the Amatriciana but on the menu it said that it was spicy but they are able to make it mild. The table next to us ask for no cream in one of the sauces and they were able to accommodate that as well. 

The baked butternut squash ravioli was recommended to us and it was amazing. The filling was smooth and creamy with just a hint of sweetness. I would go back just for that!

Chicken parmigiana was good too. The spaghetti that came with it was delicious!

We didn't know how big the portions are so ended up ordering a 3rd dish for the 2 of us. Bigoli with Amatriciana sauce. You can probably guess we weren't able to finish and had tons of left overs which they were really kind to pack up for us as well.

Wonderful service, delicious fresh made pastas. Will be back soon!

Love love love the shrimp and crab baked ravioli in the five cheese sauce.  The place is small and not very visible from the street.  They are trying to get outdoor seating which would help with their presence.  I will definately be back. The staff is outstanding.  Very friendly and welcoming.  Next visit I think I'll try the mushroom ravioli.  Nice variety of sauces and pasta that are fresh and oh so tasty!  They are also working on a beer and wine license.  I ask our server and she said it was permissible to bring in your own wine.  
We were thinking of Buca di Beppo for lunch and my husband suggested something different.  This resturant is just east of Buca on Lake Mead Blvd.  So glad we popped in.

This place is small but totally makes up for it with flavor. I really appreciate that you can customize your own entree. Pick a type of noodles, choose a sauce and meat and there you go. I ordered shrimp and scalops in a creamy white sauce with rigatoni noodles and it was delicious. I think spaghetti would have paired better but I was with co-workers and didn't want to make a mess. The garlic bread is very good. The exact crunchy and chewy combination. One of these days I'd like to try the spicy red sauce. 

I wish there was a location closer to my house.

Got the spaghetti pesto Gorgonzola and bigoli Veneto pastas. The pasta itself is great quality and cooked perfectly. Sauces are bold and flavorful. Quantities are plentiful. This place is too legit. Next they gotta add some exquisite seafood to the menu like some lobsta or scallops.

As soon as I walked in and heard the owners' Italian accent, I knew the food was going to be amazing. They started us off with garlic bread with a side of marinara and a side of chopped tomatoes with basil. IT WAS SO GOOD! Then, I ordered the ravioli with caprese sauce. The food was so fresh and delicious. The portions were crazy huge- my plate could have fed 3 people. I ate lunch at noon and six and a half hours later, I am still full (even though I had skipped breakfast).

I wish I had a place like this in Dallas!
Great place for pasta. Very clean inside and food is delicious. Will definitely go back again.

What a find!
Being new to the area I relied on my Yelp reviews and it didn't disappoint.  If you enjoy spaghetti and meatballs, this is delicious!  Meatballs moist, well- seasoned and melt in your mouth.  The pasta was cooked perfectly and I'm picky.  The garlic bread was amazing.  If you're into wonderful food and ambience isn't important this is a place you must try.  If you're looking for fine dining, try here another time.
Pretty good food I had a seafood fettuccini Alfredo and I really enjoyed at. Lunch special with a drink and bread was perfect and very filling. Service is good and food is fresh.

The Best!
We ate lunch in this little hidden Gem.
Such friendly proprietors 
and the decor is clean and modern.
When we sat down we were served garlic toast and fresh tomato basil salsa.
One of the specials was eggplant parmesan with spaghetti.
The eggplant was sliced thinly and well browned for flavor.
The red sauce was out of this world!
And my companion's porcini mushroom dish was perfect.
We had to take 1/2 of the generous portions home to enjoy later.
The tiramisu dessert was homemade, delicious and one was enough to share.
If you live in Summerlin this should be your favorite neighborhood place.
I will travel from Henderson to eat there, its that great!

I'll start by saying that I'm not one to ever write a review I just don't really do that but I have to be honest the experience that I had the first time that I want to this restaurant was very bad my check was close to $23 for one plate of pasta I got the carbonara with the bigoli and add shrimp. 5 pieces of shrimp with shells still on there tails still. gross to pick out of your mouth with a bite of pasta. Add 4.50 for that nonsense. And my pasta was all chopped up to small strands of noodles like it was recycled pasta unused from another dish. I've heard amazing things about this place fresh pasta amazing ingredients but my experience was very bad. Service was good though but I was the only one in the restaurant so eh

I have eaten here several times and loved it! The service is really good, the owner's always very cheerful and helpful. You have to wait a little bit for the food because everything is extremely fresh. It's a very small restaurant so large parties have to maybe push tables together. But they're very accommodating. Really best for groups 4 and smaller.
Great food, lots of options....including my favorite pappardelle. Choose a pasta, choose one of the 25 or sauces and be ready to eat. Large portions, made fresh by Dad in the back. Worth a visit.

It's a small, locally owned spot with freshly made pastas that far surpass what can be found at Buca di Peppo a couple blocks down. Pastas are made fresh every morning and the flavors and execution are better than what can be found at most sit down establishments off the Strip. There hasn't been much buzz about this spot, but it's a restaurant worth checking out. While small, it's good for families and a quick bite.

Check the board for daily specials, like the fettuccine diablo ($14) full of bold flavored sausages, pepperoni, pepper and sundries tomatoes lightly covered in a pink vodka sauce. Their menu has a list of specialty pastas, as well. One is baked butternut squash ravioli ($14.95), with equal amounts of sweetness and savoriness and covered in a layer of blistered cheese. 

You can build your own pasta dishes, but their pricing structure is a little awkward. You choose your pasta (there are over a dozen options priced between $4 and $10 each), then choose your sauce (over 3 dozen types from $4 to $12). I loved the pesto gorgonzola, but the gnocchi I paired it with was rather thick and dense. 

Created by the same people responsible for Spaghetti Western in Southern Highlands, this tiny spot has quickly gained in popularity despite lacking in marketing. But, judging from the crowds that constantly fill their tables, locals are already aware of this gem.
This is my absolute favorite place to eat! I can never get enough of it and everything always tastes amazing. Definitely worth the price every time! My favorite is the gnocchi with pink vodka sauce!

Must come here,  amazing food and huge portions.   Loved it. We had the Red Diablo sauce,  which had pepperoni,  sausage,  peperochini and green pepper.   Was fabulous,  best we've ever had.   Also,  had #30, Caprese which had fresh tomatoes,  basil,  garlic and fresh mozzarella balls.   Amazing!   We saw the Antipasto mistress come out and will order that as well when we come back.   You really must try this place,  everything is so fresh and pasta is homemade.

Amazing!  The best pasta I have ever had. What a treat to find this great homemade pasta restaurant while driving through Vegas. A must for every person living in Las Vegas. The butternut squash ravioli is to die for. Order family style as there is plenty to share.
Fabulous!  Definitely 5 stars - fresh, cooked to perfection pasta and amazing selections.   Best Italian food in Vegas so far.

After building up a big appetite chasing mice and cat interlopers through Pueblo Park in Summerlin, I found an hidden gem in a generic strip mall across the street. You choose from  a wide variety of pastas, Bigoli is my fave, and then choose from a wide variety of sauces  to go with. I've tried quite a few and they're all excellent I but I can't resist going with the basic marinara with meatballs. The way I see it, if an Italian joint a good 'marinar', why deviate.
Unique idea for pasta place . Try the Bigoli instead of traditional spaghetti . Just different and delicious. Lil chewer and thick

You could probably say I'm a regular here. I've tried half the menu. And I keep coming back with my eye on the specialty board. Today was the Cheese tortellini and Chicken soup. Very homemade. Love the pulled chicken.  Very satisfying on these cold days

Hidden gem!  Tasteful Italian cuisine.  Owners are from Venice.  Choose your pasta and your sauce.  Generous portions.  Skip Buca di Beppo a block away and treat yourself to delicious authentic Italian food.  The food here is so good!!!Meal comes with bruschetta.  The Nutella Cheesecake is out of this world.  Great food with great service.  Enjoy!!

Heard about this place from a friend, and it's the best Italian food I've had!

The place is very small, only 6 tables. The owner (I think) greeted us right when we walked in, and the place was busy with guests dining in and picking up for takeout.  The decor is nice and clean, you can tell attention to detail is important to the owner. They have a server come to your table rather than order at the counter and sit down. Hunter was our server, very attentive and knowledgeable (thanks!)

Let's get to the food, everything is fresh here. The pasta & sauces are made in house, and delicious! Portions are filling, there's enough to take some home.  The rigatoni with pesto & gorgonzola was flavorful. The cioppino over fettuccine was my favorite, a seafood medley of deliciousness! My only gripe: the snow crab comes with shell, so be ready to get a little dirty :)

I'm so impressed, I wish I didn't live so far from this place. But the drive is definitely worth it, I'll be coming back!

Great food with awesome service. We eat gere at least once a week... every out of town guest we have taken here and local friend or family we have purchased gift cards for this restaurant have raved about the food. And don't forget the Nutella cheesecake... it is the bomb!!!

I really wa's looking forward to going here! I happen to stumble across it when I was getting my work pants altered in the same complex. I took a menu hone and that first visit there was a nice man there who said his dad makes the pasta fresh in the morning. I was super excited and couldn't wait to tell my Italian husband about this. .
Fast forward a month later... we finally made it in. Tuesday October 3  at about  4p.m.
Walked in and wasn't greeted . But the young girl who was behind the counter let us know that they do not make their own pasta fresh! We asked her where does it come from? She said she didn't know just some company.?  I hope the owner realizes that we left because of what she said. And she really didn't seemed concerned at all. She just said bye!.
I can buy pasta at smith's down the street. I was really disappointed because I was looking forward to what the first guy told me a month prior that they make their own pasta in the a.m

When she said they get it from some company?? She didn't know where I lost my taste for even sitting in this small restaurant .  It isnt the best location .  Very disappointed .
Amazing place!  Very clean and great service. Bring your appetite!  Definitely worth the trip!

The food is great. Atmosphere is a little cramped I recommend ordering take out. Seems to be a family run business, which is awesome, but there was a kid hanging out there at the table behind us talking on his video game set and chatting with other gamers. It was a little distracting. The chicken fettuccine, lobster ravioli in a pink sauce, and butternut squash ravioli (we ordered it in carbonara sauce but they mistakenly served it in a marinara, definitely would have been better in carbonara) were delicious and fresh.

On New Year's Eve,  my caterer didn't show up.  I was stuck with no food and 20 people in the house.  So I looked on yelp, picked Pasta Idea based on ratings and boy I was not disappointed.  I called them at 7:00pm and explained my predicament and they had food for 20 people ready for me by 8:30!  Thank you Pasta Idea for saving my butt but also for some amazing pasta.  You will love their home made pasta and sauces!

Pastaidea is definitely a good idea. You want to do this, you need to do this. This is a small shop with available outdoor seating as well. The concept is simple, pick a pasta, then pick a sauce to go with it. However, the food is anything but simple. Without belaboring the point, the entrees were surprisingly delicious. Actually, some of the best pasta dishes I have had in a long while. Served fresh and hot. All said and done, our two entrees came out to about $20 each. Not inexpensive, but worth every cent. I highly recommend Pastaidea, you won't be disappointed.

My absolute go to place for pasta in Las Vegas. It is perfect everytime. Food always comes quick and is hot and delicious! Wait staff is the friendliest around! New specials all the time. Always where I recommend friends and family go when they visit vegas, way better then anything on the strip!
What refreshingly delicious little gem. Do yourself a favor and support this authentic family run Italian joint.
Great hidden gem in Las Vegas.  Everything is made fresh.

After a glorious day of climbing at Red Rocks our family was in the mood for some Italian food and Pastaidea was just the right place. The food tastes amazing! My husband and I both grew up in Germany and made many trips to Italy. Pastaidea is the only Italian place we've found so far (California/Nevada) where the food tastes like in Italy! The pasta is homemade as well as the sauces. It all tastes fresh and healthy. The complimentary Bruschetta is a dream! All the other mainstream Italian food chain places aren't even close to what Pastaidea has to offer. During our visit I was on a whole30 diet but had two "cheat days" in a row because of their exceptionally good food. I wish we had a Pastaidea here in San Jose, CA!!!
First time here and it was amazing! Great pasta and it's at such a good price! I can see me going back for as long as they're there. Definitely worth a try if you love your carbs!
Great little place with freshly made Italian dishes!i had the chicken parm with spaghetti and it was enough for 2 people!

Pleasantly surprised! The food was awesome, it was fresh and you could taste the quality! Service is excellent, well worth it. And it doesn't show it on the menu but you can buy their uncooked fresh pasta and take it home to cook yourself! My only complaint about the restaurant were there chairs. It sounds like a petty complaint until you have to sit in one of them, they are truly the most uncomfortable chairs I have ever sat in. I will definitely be going back often!

Simply awesome, our new favorite. 

This Resturant is very close to our home so we saw it had opened and decided to give it a go.  It has been a long time since we tried something new and had a "wow" factor.  This place was great.   Very friendly staff (think we met the owner too) and food was killer.  Take the Advice of the experts and let them help you pick.   They know their food better than anyone.  I made my order and they suggested a slight modification which turned out delicious.   We are soooooo happy this place opened and will be back again and again.

This place is right near my house -- so glad I stopped in for lunch ! I had their special today of gnocchi with shrimp and scallops in a pink cream sauce ... Delicious! My daughter had the fettuccine Alfredo and she said it was excellent also.cute little tiny place the probably only has five tables perfect for a quick lunch but the good news is they also deliver in my area!
Hands down the best pasta experience ever a must try! Pasta is made here and the sauces are incredible.  If you have a request they works with you better than any other pasta restauraunt! The best!
the food here tastes amazing! the staff are also very helpful and awesome! it's a good place if you're up for some pasta coz you get to choose what kind of pasta with what sauce and everything

I've never tasted and experience such unique pasta options in my life! 

I am impressed with how many types of noodle they offer, the various sauces, and the overall menu selection. For noodles, they have the basic spaghetti and fettuccine, as well as interesting ones like butternut squash and spinach ravioli. For the sauces, they have red, pink, green, creamy white, and seafood. Plus specialities pastas, a kids menu, and desserts! 

Best of all, they have a lunch special for $9.95 that includes a noodle and sauce of your choice, a drink, and garlic bread. Dine in or take out. You must try the fettuccine with the basil pesto creamy sauce.

Excellent food.  It is a little on the pricey side for casual dining, but the food is of the highest quality, and there are endless flavor options.  The mushroom ravioli is delectable, as well as their basil pesto, which is unexpectedly creamy and rich.  We are so happy we found this place!

Oh. Yum. 
Husband, daughter, and I all loved our dishes (and each other's). Even though we're just in town a few more days, it's likely we'll go back. It is pricier than your average lunch- but the food is far from average. 
There are too many choices, because every single one sounds delicious, but somehow we honed in on our pasta/sauce combos pretty quick. The waiter was friendly and helpful, answering questions and providing tips when requested (he eats the food there). 
The toast with fresh bruschetta was delicious (breads not fancy, but the bruschetta made up for it!)

The pasta came out pretty quickly, was hot and exquisite. Daughter got tricolor cheese tortellini with creamy basil pesto. Husband got bigoli (awesome thick spaghetti, that reminded me a bit of German spaetsle in texture) with carbonara, and I got butternut squash ravioli with the Veneto. I would probably pair the squash ravioli with something a little lighter. 

Ultimately, I think you can't go wrong.

Avoid this place.  New ownership, and the amazing food left with the old owners.

Update: There is so much more to running a restaurant than making the food.  I hope you take my opinion and get help with the business side so you can focus on the great food you are capable of making in the Kitchen.  Best of luck.

Delicious food! Great customer service. Found this cute little joint from the Allset app as we decided to try a new experience as I saw this was great for busy people who love dining out. Makes it super easy to order and pay for your bill (tip included) in advance!

This place is so good! I'm obsessed w/ their pink sauce pastas and the restaurant is so adorable. Staff seems nice and their portion sizes are pretty generous. You pretty much pick a sauce and type of pasta u want.

Saw this place on yelp and gave it a whirl. Me and family showed up on a Sunday around 530. Very small place only like 5 tables. It was our first time there so, thankfully we got a seat cause I guess people call ahead and reserve tables. Service was a little slow, they had one waitress and all the tables got filled up all at once. Took awhile for them to take our ordered, seemed a little unorganized. Once we finally ordered, the food came out and wow amazing flavor and huge portions. We ordered mushroom raviolis with Red Diablo sauce & chicken parm. Finally a place who knows good pasta. The garlic bread amazing which is complimentary when you dine in. I bought cannolis to take home. Those were just pooas amazing crunchy and so fresh. Done right. Can't wait to go back and try this place. Prolly will order and take home, seems a little too stressful to get in there and get a spot. Hopefully a bigger place will come soon, but totally understand the concept. Will be back gonna try some of the white sauces next time.
Excellent food. Great service. Have never had a bad dish. The bread they serve before the meal is delish.

This is my all time favorite little restaurant! It is tucked away in the corner of the shopping center, like a little jewel.The food is just amazing...fresh, flavorful, and different. If you are looking for something  special this is your place!

Absolutely delicious! At first I was disappointed because they were out of gnocchi, but I ended up getting the five cheese baked butternut squash ravioli and it was spectacular! It came as a large portion with a creamy, sweet, and rich sauce. The sauce has mushrooms and speck, and the ravioli were tender and filled with creamy butternut squash. My boyfriend got the chicken parmigiana. It was huge and came with a side of spaghetti and marinara. It had a great coating and was topped with bubbling cheese. It was a little pricey, but absolutely wonderful. I will be back for the gnocchi!

First star is for the concipe A for effort. Second star for an amazing caprice salad that was served. Meatballs were such a waste of a meatball what could have been a deliciousness of meaty goodness fell hard on it's knees due to the texture of smoosh and flavorless water that exploded in my mouth. My mushroom ravioli could have been another great dish if it wasn't for the over powering taste of flour used as the main ingredient in their Alfredo sauce. A great disappointment to always having to ask for bread which wasn't the best but what's pasta without bread. A big pass on this idea.. Hopefully someone will come up with a much flavorful one until then I'm gonna stick to Olive Garden.

Takes a bit to get me to a 5. I would never have gone there if someone had not invited me.  What a surprise a little hole in the wall with four tables. I was not looking forward to this.
Then the food started rolling out. WOW, dam good and huge portions. 
Come to find out most of the business is Take out......
I can say that if Im going to have some great food and take it home THIS is the place. They do not have a liquor license, but you can BYOB.
Great service also. 
Certainly put it on your list for an Italian meal.

The past her is good.....
The place is small but not bad.......
Good service....

I will come back  aging....

Fabulous food! Much better Italian food then Buca de beppo restaurant right next to them. I highly recommend this place for a great pasta meal. The pasta is made at the store, the owners are wonderful and nice and the food is so delicious

Verrrrrrry Tasty!   My wife and I have come here a few times and the food is excellent and the people working there were extremely pleasant. 

It doesn't feel like a sit down place, although they do have a few tables.  I have dined in and had trouble with the comfort of the chairs - while stylish, not so good for sitting in.  This is more of an order and take to go type of place in my opinion.

Why three stars and not higher?  Because it's pricey in my opinion for not being a sit down type of place.  Ya pick your pasta for one variable price and then your sauce for another variable price.  Again, eating goodness but I actually went, "damn!" On the price.  Thus, the other day after craving pasta and thinking of this place - deciding to pass because of price (for a mostly take out type of place). 

It's worth a try for sure - but not sure I am to be a regular even though it's less than a mile from my house.

They're food is excellent and if you love homemade pasta from scratch , this is the place for you. Not a lot of seating, but that's okay, you can order it to go. Either fine in or take out you won't be disappointed!

Hidden little gem! What's cool about this place is that you can customize how you want your pasta dish to be. I mean it can get pricy if you keep on adding more stuff to your pasta or even what type of pasta noodle you get. We ordered the chicken parmigiana and pappardelle with a meat sauce and meat balls. Let me tell you the portions are HUGE! I feel one dish is enough for two people. The chicken parm was so good. Maybe a lil better than most top Italian restaurants. The pappardelle was not bad I felt the noodles were a lil hard side and not al dente. The sauce was on point tho. Before they serve the main dishes, they give you bread and fresh tomatoes. I want to go back and try their ravioli!

Wow! This place is awesome. It just opened and the food is authentic and delicious. I really can't think of any authentic Italian places besides going down to the strip... 

The decor is contemporary and clean. You can tell they take pride in their restaurant. The service was very friendly and everyone there was very nice.

I got the papadelle with campania sauce (a pink sauce with prosciutto, sundried tomatoes and roasted garlic). Literally amazing. The pasta is homemade and fresh and the portion size is generous. They served it with a piece of garlic bread and fresh tomatoes... Um yes please.

Overall, super impressed and really excited to try more things off the menu. Check this place out for sure.

So my boyfriend and I used to come here twice a week and bring friends and it was our FAVORITE place to eat! Food was amazing and the people were so nice. We took about a 2-3 month break over the Holidays and we were so disappointed when we came back. For starters, we were sad when we got here and didn't see our usual servers working. Then we picked our table only to realize that it was covered in ants.. when we told the waiter his respose was "Oh, let me clean the table off for you". Seriously? Just an oh... I was so grossed out! We still decided to stay unfortunately and just move to an ant-free table. There were 2 servers and it took a good while of us staring in their direction to get our order taken.. and when I asked for my sauce without pepperoncinis the women asked me 3 times what I was talking about before having to look at a menu to understand what I was asking. Ugh! So we finally get our food and we both ordered the same sauce, however mine was suuuper light and runny (way too much cream) and my boyfriend's was way darker and spicier. SO DISAPPOINTED!! Sad to say that this may be our last trip....

I came here with a friend the other night to give this new hot spot a try. Homemade sauces and homemade pasta sounded good  to me.

Here at Pasta Idea, your possibilities for dinner seem almost endless. You have the ability to make your dinner what you want it to be. Start by selecting one of the many homemade pastas (around 10 I think). Next, chose your sauce. There are red sauces, pink sauces, white sauces, creamy white sauces. Its maddening when you're hungry and everything looks good. 

I settled on papardelle pasta with arrabiatta sauce. The pasta, wider than fetuccini but not as wide as lasagna, was very much al dente and maybe could have used a minute more in the water. My opinion of course. Still, it was delicious. The arrabiatta sauce was amazing. A fresh and spicy marinara loaded with olives. There was just enough spice to get my sinuses working overtime. The olives were rather strong tasting. Very briney. I would have preferred them to be chopped and tossed in the sauce more. Again, just my opinion. The people who run this place are from Italy and probably know what they are doing.

I also had a couple of pieces of garlic toast. One piece I had before my meal came out. It was served with a tomato dressing. Chopped tomato and garlic. Like a bruscheta I guess. That was good. The second piece of bread was served with my pasta amd was perfect to sop up the sauce.

Pasta Idea has a lot going for it with the whole fresh pasta and sauce technique. A freshness that you can most certainly taste. What is working against them is location. They are in a tiny corner suite of a strip mall and they cannot be seen from the street. In fact, I could not even see them from the parking lot. I had to get out and walk around to find them. But if you are in the NW and looking for good Italian food, do yourself a favor and find Pasta Idea.

Italians are very critical of each other's cooking and as an Italian I cannot say enough good things about this very small yet pristine little Italian restaurant. The food is outstanding! From the appetizers, right down to the homemade dessert. This is a diamond in the ruff and let me just say that they out do all Italian restaurants in Las Vegas.

My husband and I ordered pickup. When we got the food home, my meal had items in it that were not listed on the menu ( I don't eat meat and it was loaded with bacon, which was not listed in the ingredients on the menu). We called the restaurant to make sure we got the correct item we ordered, and we did. They explained this is how this specific dish is served. The man on the phone said he would replace it with something else. We went back to the restaurant, and the person we talked to on the phone was not there, of course, and the girl that was there, said she could give us a $3 credit. Three dollars does not cover the $20.00 spent on the food I could not eat and was mislabeled on the menu. My husband was please with his food, however, the service was so bad, we will not return. It's important for a restaurant to remember that service is just as important as the food you serve. There are hundreds of good restaurants in Las Vegas, and I would recommend one with good food and good service.

Nice small restaurant with pasta specialities. Large choice of pastas and dressings !
For me it was the "chicken parmigiano" but I'm a little bit disappointed because the chicken was so hard... I don't know if the chicken was fresh or if it was old preparation...
Pastas were goods, average price.

Friendly and helpful service, nice atmosphere, and a wide variety of fresh made pasta and sauces to choose from. I chose a daily special - rigatoni with peppers, sausage, mushrooms and peppers in a fresh tomato sauce. Wow! The rigatoni was cooked perfectly - it has to be super al dente to hold up to the sauce when eating leftovers, and this did! Simply because the portion was very generous and I had filled up on the delicious garlic bread and bruschetta. The chicken was the juiciest and most tender! Just love it here, can't waiting come back and try more!
The pasta was so fresh and good. Service amazing. Had the pink diablo sauce. I love spicy and this was just the right amount of spicy.
I don't know what happened. The food is nowhere near what it was when they opened. Such a shame since the food was so good.

Officially have eaten here twice. Only have tried the chicken ceasar salads but boy are they great. The aromas coming from the kitchen make you want to know more. The flavor profile says this isn't fast food and we are giving you a glimpse of real Italian food is supposed to taste like. Yep. I'm getting this message from the bruschetta.  Laugh if you want but you need to try it for yourself.

This is the cutest hidden restaurant! If you're looking for authentic Italian food - this is your place. They have a variety of pastas & countless types of sauces - sauces I have never heard of! You can literally come here all the time & still try something new! And the service is top notch. You're greeted (no matter how buy they are), your seated or serviced (if picking up), or whatever your story. Of course their food is ridiculous - amazingly ridiculous! It's so filling - FULfilling! 

This place is a MUST. A BIG must. I HIGHLY recommend to everyone and anyone.
Love the food, service, and atmosphere. Everything is homemade and the portions are generous. Great experience every time we've gone.

It was super yummy!! There was four of as and we all got different things to eat. The portions are very large and also the breadsticks are very yummy this is not a whole lot of seating about six tables. Not for big groups of people. They do have catering and also take out.
If you love carbs then you will love this place! I'm a carbaholic. The squash ravioli with the cheese sauce blew my mind! So good
Really nice staff. Chef accommodated me for being gluten free no prob!! Nice cozy spot. Food was good too. When I'm by summerlin I'll be going back

Delish! This review is long over due, but better late then never, right? Went her on a casual date night with my love and it was great! We had the lobster ravioli to start- that alone probably would have been enough to fill me up and was lip smacking good! I also had the gluten free fettuccine with pink sauce and it was SO GOOD! My boyfriend had the Bolognese and was over the moon happy with his choice. Our server was super sweet and attentive.
Love this place! We have only ordered delivery from them but the food is always fantastic and the service is always much faster than the estimate.
This was our first time there. The food was delicious. I had the gnocchi with shrimp and scallop fra diavlo. We will be back again.
Food and service are excellent. Portions are generous enough to share. The only complaint is there is not enough tables to dine in. A must try!

I just tried it today for lunch and it was excellent. I love that you pick a pasta and sauce customization. It's delicious and they give you bread with tomatoes too. Will definitely go back. It was a cute little shop too, almost missed it driving by.
Love this little spot. Everything is delicious and the staff makes you feel like they enjoy serving you. The pasta is homemade and perfectly al dente and the sauces are amazing!

Some of the best Italian food I have ever had. Everyone is so nice and welcoming. Not the typical look as a normal Italian restaurant, it has a more modern feel to the style. Also every time I have been in there the place is always so clean. I recommend it to everyone I know that like Italian food.

Delicious! So
Many options to choose from and every last one of them is 100% authentic. Portion sizes are huge and the owner is very kind and enthusiastic. I love the idea of "fast" and inexpensive Italian food and this one delivers with no compromises. You know you're in the right place when an Italian signore enjoys his lunch next to you.

A variety of pastas and sauces to choose from, this is definitely a hidden gem away from the noise and crowd of Vegas. The layout is also hip and cozy. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for a laid-back, cozy dinner either with your family or significant other.

Did not disappoint my Rome, Italy  born husband! Olive Garden is a swear word in our house!! But our first (and not last) trip to Pastaidea was DELISH! Lobster Ravioli and the mushroom ravioli were Devine! Also loved the simple atmosphere!

Ok, Ive been back a few times, and I've tried the basic marinara, and it definitely stands out! It has a great rich and tangy flavor.....you could put it on cardboard and I would probably enjoy it (although it's even better on their gnocchi). As promised, I'm bumping up my review to 5 stars. I honestly struggle going out to "casual Italian" restaurant because I always feel like I could have made a better meal for much less, but this place is unique. It's very fairly priced, and everything is made fresh from scratch.

Update:   My husband and I were informed by the Owner of pasta idea that December 31 was their last day in business. I then posted a review indicating our disappointment in them closing and selling out because they are truly the best pasta place around.   I was subsequently reported for 'lying' because the business is still open. I actually just spoke with the NEW owner, and yes it was sold on 12/31/16. They were not supposed to use the same name "pasta idea" but apparently some deal was worked out to keep the name.  So the facts are: its a different owner, and different menu, with the same name.  The woman on the phone was super pleasant and understanding about the situation, and she encouraged us to go in and try their new menu. We will actually be doing that today for lunch!
This place is amazing. The ambience is lacking but the pasta is deliciaous and portions are huge!   I would definitely come back.

Ordered 200 ravioli for a party and they were great. Butternut squash was the favorite and the mushroom ravioli was a close second. Smelled wonderful when I walked in, so I was reassured that my blind decision to use this place for my party would be okay. Will definitely go back.

Our Server/Cashier Hunter was charming and very informative with amazing suggestions of the Red Diablo sauce with choice of pasta I selected Papardelle was delicious!  Our meal started with the most amazing Garlic Bread and Brusetta-- fresh tomatoes, fresh basil and garlic WOW..light and refreshing-- Hubby got  half Spinach and Cheese Ravioli with Five Cheese Sauce was decadent!! Next time I will order the  Spaghetti and Caprese sauce because I gobbled up all of the bruschetta no bread needed!!! The pasta is made FRESH everyday!  World of difference!!!  The restaurant is very quaint seating is limited, they have a very popular to go business.  Chef Carlos is a true artist!  Bon Appetite Everyone!!

Easily 5 stars based on price and quality. You chose your own noodles then choose a sauce. They have almost any combination of pastas and sauces you can think of. Def worth what you spend and the amount and quality you get. 

Small, clean, family ran, and overall quality pasta dont need pricey olive garden or macroni grill when you got this place.

This is one of the newest restaurants in the Summerlin area.  Their concept is good and very interesting. You can select your pasta and the sauce you want. Their pasta is homemade authentic italian. You have about 10 different pasta options to select from and over 20 different sauces... They have it all! The portions size are very generous, you will for sure have left overs! I went over for lunch and they had a lunch special of pasta and a sauce plus and drink for 9.99. However, the offer is a bit deceiving because you can only pick two or three sauces for lunch. The rest of the menu was full price.  So at the end we spent about $15 each, which sounds a bit much for a lunch entree. Especially when you can go to olive garden and have all you can eat soup or salad and a pasta bowl for $6.99. In my opinion those two restaurants are similar in taste. The flavors were good, but nothing memorable.

I was on my way to cafe rio and realized the line was out the door, I was bummed out until I realized pasta idea is in the same parking lot! We ordered from here once at work and I had the baked mushroom ravioli and it was delicious. Today I got the chicken parm because the gentleman at the register recommended it and I wasn't let down. So delicious and the portion is HUGE. And it's so cheesy! I only ate half the chicken and about a third of the spaghetti and I'm stuffed! They mostly have different types of pasta and meats that you pair with sauces and they have a ton of different sauces. It's about the same price as like Olive Garden but better. My dinner was $15 but I get at least two meals out of it. Maybe even a third small meal. The staff was super nice. It is small so it's not a good place for big groups but I'd rather eat while I watch my Netflix afterwards anyways lol

We stopped here while visiting from out of state and we were very happy with our choice. The food was delicious and they give you good portions. The customer service was excellent! It's a small place with a homey feel.

Loved this place. Decided to look for some good food elsewhere instead of paying a premium on the strip. Found this place after reading some good reviews on yelp. The place is small but the food was awesome. Fresh pasta and freshly made sauce. Family owned and the service is great. The portions were very generous and they were willing to make variations to suit our taste. The dessert and coffee was great too. We ordered the spaghetti, gnocchi, fettuccine and rigatoni. Loved the fresh taste of the pasta.

Great place for lunch or dinner. Pasta is fresh and sauces are amazing. All portions are huge and can be split. We had the arrabiata with tri color tortellini, it was very tasty. They also have gluten free pasta!

For authentic, "home made" Italian Food, go to Pasta Idea on Lake Mead and Buffalo in Summerlin.  Easily accessible from either the 95 or 215 freeways.

Pasta Idea just opened a few days ago, but my husband and I have already been there at least 3 times!  The food is magnifico!   With every meal you get bruschetta (garlic bread w/ tomatoes, basil in olive oil).  The pasta is all home-made from scratch.  They also serve delicious home-made soups.

I have tried several items on the menu, and they are all excellent!  My favorites are:  Meatball Appetizer, the salads, Lobster Ravioli w/pink sauce, Shrimp Alfredo; and their Lasagna is to die for!  For dessert they serve home-made Tiramisu, Cannoli, Cheesecakes; which are great with their cappuccino or espresso made with illy Coffee Beans from Italy.

When you go to Pasta Idea, ask for Chef Chiara!  She is very good at what she does; and she is also very friendly!  

Happy Eating! Ciao!

Went with a friend who loves this place. Swears by the mushroom ravioli. 

I had their GF fettuccine. It was carelessly cooked (noodles stuck together like if you don't stir them), and a little more al dente than I'd have liked. Flavor was subpar, consistency was a little odd....it was somehow both undercooked and falling apart. Barilla does it better. 

Also, they served a breadstick with my GF pasta. *eye roll* If I were more severely averse to wheat I'd have sent it back. 

The rest of it was good though, and service was friendly if a bit hard to track down to get condiments and refills of water. I'd come back, but I would choose to suffer for a day or so in order to have their regular pasta.

3-stars until more data points exist.

What an incredible surprise! My boyfriend and I stopped in on a whim and WOW! The service was wonderful but the food is what we will come back for again and again. The truffle burrata special was delectable and the fresh, house made pasta was exquisite! In fact, the food was so good we asked to compliment the owner, Andrea. And yes, he is straight from Italy. My only minor complaint is the ambiance. Radio with commercials and the sound of the dishes being washed are not the best but you will not walk away disappointed!!

This place is a joke! Being run by "teenagers" who are in need of going to school for business management.

We came in yesterday at 8pm. Everything was good until our food came. My husband ordered the special of the day with the "meat sauce" etc. The pasta was super dry and bland. So we asked our server for extra sauce on the side so the food won't be so dry. They gave us marinara sauce ONLY.  Another teen came by the name "carrie" and we told her were canceling the order. She insisted on making another one but we said no, it's fine we don't want it. She replies you can't do that. She then takes the food to the back. When we were finished with our meal, she hands us our receipt and said we had to pay for the pasta we didn't eat. I refused to pay for something we didn't eat but she kept insisting we pay. When I ask for management, another young teen with a beard, said there's no management and no contact of manager. I asked well what happens if there's an emergency? He replies, this is not an emergency. I told carrie, I refused to pay for the pasta cause we didn't eat the food, if I have to, I'll pay my only bill I ate and will call the cops to escorts us out. Then she  blurts out, we're a small business here and your no longer allowed here. Totally fine with me, with the bad customer service I doubt I'll ever step back in. I ended up paying only for what we ate and left. 
Too bad, this place could've been good but with the lack of knowledge of customer service, it shows a lot they will not succeed in business.
This place was so amazing!!! Everything we ate was amazing! It's a little hidden but worth visiting if you love Italian food
Great food every time I order on line from yelp. The service is great and I have never had bad order or any mistakes on my food.
really enjoyed our meal here. the portions were large, which is always a plus.  really authentic tasting Italian pasta.  good attentive friendly service.  5 stars!
Great little place.  Great food and you make the choices of pasta type and sauce. Only like 8 tables.  Easy location in Summerlin.  Right on Lake Mead just past Buffalo

You will only come here for INCREDIBLE Italian food! All the 5 star reviews are true! Family owned place. The son welcomed us as we walked in! Dad is in early making the pasta from scratch! The textures and flavors were amazing! I really almost cried; it was delicious beyond what I could ever describe! Sit down and enjoy! You will come back! I promise! I am ecstatic about this find!

I truly enjoy PastaIdea. this small restaurant packs a wallop in flavor and portions. I order the Chicken Picatta with Spaghetti noodles( I wish the had Angel Hair) and it was 1 of the best I've tasted. Hot fresh And Lemony with a generous serving size.

Bigoli noodles. It's what you'd imagine would come out of a Play Doh fun factory. In a good way. The pasta has a great texture which clings to sauce and a wonderful bite. The pink Capania sauce was delish. Lots of sun dried tomatoes, very well seasoned, and served HOT and fresh. Service warm and friendly. I look forward to coming back and trying more pasta/sauce combos. The menu is extensive and given 20+ pastas and even more sauces the options are endless. Plus I saw ravioli, lasagne and other baked dishes as well as dessert on the menu.
It is just a small little place, but the food was great and the people were fun. We had Caesar salads, the chicken Parmesan and the chicken marsala.

Best pasta in the northwest LV!!  They have like 20 varieties of pasta, numerous sauces and an amazing garlic bread with bruschetta that comes with your meal.  Tons of food; always get a 2nd meal out of entree. $9.95 lunch special is amazing value!!  Some of our favorites are chicken parm and papardelle with diablo sauce
Chicken fettuccine, butternut squash, tortellini with marinara and fettuccine with vodka sauce and all were amazing! Excellent service too.

I read reviews for this place and was so excited to try a place that made fresh, organic pasta. I'm sorry, this place was not good. I mean seriously not good. The reviews are extremely misleading. Which leads me to the conclusion they are all from family members and friends. 

We ordered four different dishes and didn't like any of them. Their signature chicken parmigiana had very little taste. The kids Mac and cheese tasted like warm milk and the sauce was about as thin. My son wouldn't touch it. The best dish we had was the pesto pasta with Gorgonzola, it had some good basil flavor but lacked seasoning.
