We had a little bit of each and then fed the rest to our dog. :( $50 down the drain. 

After finding the food to be so lack luster and the reviews not a good representation of said food, I feel taken advantage of, never how you want to feel after eating out. Fool me once, Pasta Idea.

Cute little restaurant that is great for a good quick eat or take out! You get to create your own fish by choosing your pasta and sauce separately. Most of the sauces come with meats and/or veggies in it. The menu makes it simple to pick what you want by dividing the sauces up by the base. Everything tastes pretty fresh. They give you garlic bread with a tomato spread that I could eat foreverrr but had to stop myself so I had room for my main dish. I tried the pappardelle pasta with imported porcini mushrooms and prosciutto crudo. The sauce itself was a little bland but the prosciutto provided the saltyness it needed. Definitely add black pepper. I also tried spaghetti and meatballs. The sauce was really tasty. Meatballs were juicy and so tender on the inside. The sauce also comes with meat chunks in it as well.

This is my all time favorite place in Las Vegas! The pasta is made FEESH TO ORDER. Their food is real and their flavor is impeccable. I felt like I was in Italy! Such a sweet family owned place that I wish could become a chain! Best service, fresh free bread with pesto sauce and bruschetta. What more could you ask for?

First time for lunch. Jeremías was our waiter. He was infectious with his bright and upbeat personality!  He explained the awesome menu to us, and helped us navigate the extremely delicious entree's. The combinations are endless. Pasta was cooked Al Dente perfect. My wife had Alfredo sauce and I had shrimp and scallops Fra Diablo. 
Go see Jeremías and have a wonderful and delicious afternoon!
Perfecto!

A tiny little hole in the wall in the north Summerlin area; tucked in a hidden corner so you might miss it if you aren't paying attention.  I think it seats less than twenty people, so don't be surprised when you walk in.    

They offer wide arrange of homemade pasta and it's all good...  You get your white sauce, red sauce and pink sauce.  Every time I bring people here, be it friends or business associates, they are always pleasantly surprised with how good the food is.  

Come try it out and make this hidden gem your go-to pasta place.

This is a great place to go to when you want quality pasta in a casual format. I get the macaroni and cheese which is my favorite! It is very reminiscent of a cheesier alfredo with a crumb top, but it is just so so good. They serve all orders with a piece of garlic bread, which is equally delicious. It is cheaper than some dishes you would find in olive garden, and it is great that you can just get whatever you want to-go if you are in a rush but want good food. The only down side is that it is very very small place. If you have a larger party, I would not suggest you go here. But you should definitely give it a try!

Pasta made fresh and delicious!  Amazing sauces. Small and intimate, yet casual restaurant/ cafe. Specials every day. A few casual desserts to choose from. The people are warm and welcoming. Espresso to finish it off. No alcohol. This is quite literally my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. I always introduce good friends to this place, and bring dates I want to impress with good food and a friendly atmosphere. Hometown feel type restaurant in cafe environment in the big city where everything else is over the top and impersonal. A must-stop for top quality pasta.

SERIOUSLY, my new favorite place to eat HANDS DOWN! 
We have eaten there a few times now and I can not complain at all about the food or service!
Can't wait to have my birthday catered!!!!

The pasta here is so yummy! You pick your pasta and then your sauce, voilà!, a customized pasta dish to your liking. :P They even have a big poster with pictures of the different pastas they make - easy reference when you don't remember what's what. They also have a specialty menu if you just want to try something they put together and, even better, specials of the day! So many options, you'll definitely find something to hit the spot. 

This was my second time here. I got one of the specialty menu dishes - the butternut squash ravioli with speck and mushrooms in a 5 cheese sauce. SO GOOD. I definitely recommend this dish! I mean, it was the dish that I ordered the first time that made me come back today. :) Also, they give you a plate of bread, with tomato in a bowl if you wish to add that on top. YUM! Writing this review is making my mouth water. Haha! Okay, back to the review...

Service here is amazing. The waitress and waiter are always stopping by to see how we're doing and if we need anything. It's a pretty small space for a restaurant - about 4 tables that fit 4 people (5 if they add a chair to the end) with a couple 2-seaters, if I remember correctly. Then there's also outside seating too. If you have a big group, definitely recommend calling ahead so they can put the tables together and reserve them for you. That being said, once the kitchen starts cooking a bunch of dishes, it gets a little hot inside the restaurant. Overall, definitely a spot I will be coming back to and recommend others to try!

We were so excited to finally try this place. Unfortunately, it did not live up to our expectations. I ordered the Chicken Piccata with Papardelle pasta. The only thing I could taste or smell were the capers. There had to be at least fifty if those very strong tasting berries. There were no herbs, no salt, and certainly no garlic. If there was, it was undetectable. After three bites, I just gave up. Sadly, the chicken was undercooked. I would understand if they had just recently opened, but that wasn't the case. To add insult to injury, with tax and tip it was almost forty dollars. As the food was to go, I couldn't even return it so that they could recook it. I was going to call and complain, but after reading other diners reviews here and the way they described managements handling of issues, I decided it would be a waste of time. I truly feel cheated. It's an awful feeling when you were expecting something else.

Super good food here. Was amazed by how good it was. But also super expensive here too. But that's okay, here you get what you pay for. So many different possibilities of pastas, you can probably never order the same dish twice. Will come back soon.

Excellent place for fresh authentic pasta. I highly recommend this place for both takeout and for a sit down meal. Their sauces are delicious and the menu is affordable. Splurge on the tiramisu desert!

They need to hire a consultant about food ratios and presentation. My gnocchi came smothers in sauce literally to the brim of the plate. Presentation wise it didn't look visually appealing but tasted good. 

All in all they charge a lot because the plate is literally overflowing with food.

This place has been open a year I can't believe I didn't find it sooner! So the idea is to pick a pasta any pasta and pair it with any sauce. Great selection to choose from. Everything we had was delicious! Our service was fantastic. The hardest thing is just trying to decide! I had the bigoli pasta with meat sauce and meat balls. My husband had the gnocchi with meat sauce. We got the cheese cake to go for dessert!

Wow.  Awesome place!  Great friendly service and a nice, comfy feel.  The garlic bread was delicious with fresh tomatoes and a chimchurri sauce that tasted fresh and amazing.  The homemade pasta was cooked perfect.  My wife had spaghetti and meatballs.  The meatballs were to die for.  I had fettuccini alfredo with chicken which was equally delicious.  Can't wait to come back and try some more dishes.

Delicious! We just moved from Ga, and were so happy to find a great Italian restaurant in the area.  We had the sausage, peppers and onions which was grest, we also had the meatball sub, fantastic! We will be back-

I came to this tiny spot on a whim with my MIL and was surprised by the delicious pasta that it's become a mainstay for me and my family. I feel like I need to come once a week. 

They make the noodles in house and I'm a sucker for fresh pasta! Then there is a large amount of sauce choices. They also have a chaulkboard outside with specials and they do a lunch menu too.

I have a few favorites; I enjoy their pink sauce quite a bit and tend to lean more often than not to order something with it. It's definitely my favorite pink sauce out there. My two favorite combinations is fettucine with the Pink Diablo sauce (pepperoni,sausage, pepperoncini,sundried tomatoes) or pappardelle with the mushoom proscruitto cream sauce. I generally have liked everything I've ordered though! The only thing I was neutral about is the fra diavolo seafood pasta and meatballs. Their portions are hefty here so you will either get the itis eating it all or have enough for another meal. I admit to having had breakfast spaghetti a few times. 

The gals here are super sweet to boot. I have come here only once on a weekend and found it crazy packed since theres only like 5 tables so I tend to eat here weekday nights. 

If you love a hearty satisfying pasta meal, this is a great bet for quality, portion and friendliness! 

Definitely one of my favorite new finds in town to dine at after a long day at work.

Free bruschetta, I wasn't excepting that all. 
I think all Italian restaurant should do free bruschetta. 
Most Mexican restaurant do free chips makes sense to me. 
Any ways. I been wanting to trying this Pastaidea place for a month. North Italia got in the way last week but was able to stop here for lunch yesterday. 

The service was amazing, he got me bread with in a minute that I was there. I didn't think I was going to have an amazing experience due to the place being small. I honestly think they should come up to centennial hills where it much needed. Quick and fast homemade pasta. 

I have the lobster ravioli with Alfredo sauce which it was only $18 pretty cheap, my girl had the chicken. Garlic sauce. 
With a noodle I never heard before. Bugoli, it's pretty thick noodle. Their claim, they're the only ones in town with it. Might be true cause I never seen it. 

Most likely to come back and try other type of past and sauces. It's a must for lunch or they're even in uber eats for delivery.

Went last night with a group of 3 friends to celebrate a friend's birthday. Our server Hailey was really nice and very helpful with explaining how to order since it was our first time. We ordered a beef tortellini, two
chicken alfredos, and the seafood pasta dish (it has an Italian name and I don't really remember it).

The best thing is the portions! They are quite large for the price. I was especially impressed with the seafood dish, it had crab legs and clams I believe. Lots of seafood and pasta for about $20 bucks! The pasta is delicious. My chicken Alfredo had lots of chicken too. I'm used to having to ration it out to have enough sauce and noodles. 

We ordered cannoli for dessert and they were delicious, as well! Everything was really good, nice atmosphere. Very kind people. If you are craving high quality pasta (I'm so tired of Olive Garden), then this is the place to go.

This was ok. I like that it's a small business and I like supporting small businesses, but there are still some kinks that need to get worked out here. 

The food was ok, you basically create your own pasta which is nice. Our food took reallly long to to get, when my mom got her food hers was cold. I assume they weren't  expecting a busy Mother's Day. 

I thought the staff was knowledgeable and very sweet. They gave all the women flowers and the mothers a special Mother's Day dessert for Mother's Day which I thought was really adorable. Yet another reason I like to support local businesses. 

I don't know if I'd go back to this restaurant ...possibly if they drop the prices a bit, because I don't feel that the food was worth the price.
I wish I had words to describe how amazing this food is here everything is cooked perfectly and the Canoli is OMG to die for!

Seriously the best pasta. Restaurant quality and service is great.. people are very sweet. My favorites are pasta ramagna, shrimp and scallpos fra Diablo. Cheesecake is so fresh and homemade. Love this place and I order at least twice a week.

So I've been coming here the past 6 months or so. I really enjoy the food but the last two times I've gone recently the meat has been really Fatty. Seems like they are using lesser quality stuff or trying to save some money. Hopefully it was just a bad batch or something. Other then that the service is WONDERFUL. Minus these last two visits, the pasta has been the best I ever had.
Great from start to finish. The people behind the counter were attentive. The food was fantastic and what a great idea! Pick your own pasta and sauce! It was delicious
Super good pasta.  Nice variety of options.  Well definitely be returning!  Service is super fantastic as well.
Delicious pasta and the service is great. This is a cute little place to come for lunch or take out!!!

Great concept, super friendly service. Small little place mainly for takeout (seats about 15) excellent pasta great texture and super flavorful sauces. They make their pasta from scratch in house and you can taste the difference. Some of the best pasta Ive had in a long time. Seriously good. 5/5

Coming from work, we decided to stop here for simple dinner on valentine's day. Food is delicious and the staff were amazing. Since it was Valentine's Day, they gave us 2 free dessert, very nice of them. I compare this place like those small restaurants in San Francisco that they serve their specialty and people would line up for that. Same in Pastaidea by the time we got out, people started lining.

I am going to give 5 stars for the food itself and service. They serve complimentary tasty bruschetta and bread while you wait for your meal. The pasta is so fresh and the sauces are delicious. They do not overload the pasta with the sauces. Just enough to get some in every bite. Can be a bit pricey but for the quality it is well worth it and the portions are decent. 3 pasta dishes and 3 drinks were $61.00 not including tip. Two items that should be noted.  Do not order the water or fountain drinks.  They all had an awful taste to them.  Had to order drinks from the beverage refrigerator.  Also this is a small place and was very warm inside. Made for uncomfortable dining.
I love this cute little cafe. I had ordered from them a couple of times on Postmates but I had never been inside the restaurant. It's super adorable and quaint and the food is delicious as always.

Such a wonderful lil place.   FRESH pasta cooked perfectly!   So much to choose from,  first the type of pasta, then the sauce and the toppings that go with it.   I had spinach ravioli with the white sauce, mushrooms, sausage and Asiago.   Wow!  Rest of the family.   Bigoli with scallop and shrimp fra diavolo, light and a lil spicy,  fettuccine with chicken, garlic, broccoli and grape tomatoes...spaghetti with pink vodka sauce and a kid's spaghetti and meatballs.   NOTHING was just, "ok."  EVERYTHING was tasty and cooked beautifully.   You must also try the homemade tiramisu, and Nutella cheesecake with cappuccino.

Really cute, small place to eat. My family and I were very impressed with the tasty, yummy food, as well as the quick service. The food tasted very fresh! We loved the bread with the tomatoes and tried the meat sauce and chicken Marsala. Both were amazing!!! I recommend this place if you're craving Italian.

Three stars since the food was good and the portions were big. However the restaurant is super small with maybe six tables.   Service was mediocre.  Probably not a place I will return to or would have even visited if it hadn't been picked by a co-worked.  Since it's so small it felt a little cluttered.

Great pasta and sauces, it was all very fresh. I Had the carbonara, my boyfriend had the pink diablo and we also shared lasagna for the table. The carbonara was the best I've had in town. The Diablo was like nothing I've had before so flavorful and spicy, delicious!!
Honestly..best pasta in town...choose the pasta..and choose the sauce on it..amazing..so tastey..nothing from a can...u can taste freshness

Wow. My first time here, but it won't be the last. The fresh pasta and all the different options: it can only be described as simply amazing.

I had the Bigoli with meat sauce because it was the picture on the front of the menu. It looked good. They told me that Bigoli is a larger version of a spaghetti noodle, which it was. It was a bit larger than I was expecting, but I enjoyed every bite. The portions are huge and it is very affordable for the freshness and portion size. 

I highly recommend this place!

Awesome little place, first time here. Only wish I checked this place out sooner. It is small inside, so don't dine in with a large group, but they do take-out and deliver. The Pink Diablo sauce has a great kick to it, the chicken parm is massive. Great quality, service, and atmosphere. Definitely coming back for more.

This little pasta place really delivers on quality and customer service. The idea is simple, pick your pasta and then pick your sauce. I've been here multiple times and each time I've had something different because it has all looked good and I've never been disappointed. 

The staff is incredibly friendly and they're always helpful when I've asked for recommendations. The garlic bread is a great way to start the meal, and then your main course comes out, the portions are big, I always have leftovers and I am very happy to eat them later. 

If you come during lunch, check out the lunch specials.

Stumbled across this place on accident with my mom and sister and I'm SO glad we did. Let's start with the decor, It's fresh and clean with the cutest decor hanging on the walls really makes it feel like home. The food was absolutely outstanding. Nothing we had was less than amazing and there was so much we ended up taking a lot home. The service was incredible as well. Jeremias welcomed us as soon as we walked in the door. He was so friendly and answered any questions that we had. He was more than happy to stand and talk with us and definitely added to the experience. This was our first time here but we will definitely be back!!

They have a very nice claim in white wine sauce. We had it with spaghetti and it's so delicious!

We also ordered five cheese catavelli also really good.

Definitely will come again

By far my favorite Italian place! The service is always prompt and the team is very hospitable. I've ordered delivery several times as well and have had no issues. The pasta is always fresh and the sauce is to die for. Love it!

This place is INCREDIBLE! Not only is it the most authentic Italian I've ever had (freshly made noodles!) but the service is incredible! I loved it so much that when a different restaurant backed out last minute of catering for my party, I called Pasta Idea and they saved the day only 4 hours before the party, gave a great discount and even offered to provide all the extras I needed! Once again, so impressed! Go support this small business, you will NOT regret it!!!

Very very good I asked them to make me anything of their preference and they did not disappoint.they gave me some amazing bigoli with their diablo sauce and it was more then amazing.their excitement on surprising me made it more then a delight because I can tell they enjoy what they do and what they do is amazing I recommend Pasta Idea to anyone looking for some good home made food with an amazing environment

Amazing Whole in thee Wall place ! Great find ! Their portions are beyond what you expected enough for two ! The flavors are all there I could find a better last minute dinner for movie night with my neices !

Great food. Great service. Love the homemade pasta (bigoli is my favorite). Will definitely be back. 

Just one suggestion: bring back the mushroom, sausage and asiago white sauce! That was the best and now it's no longer on the menu.

been coming here for a while now. always got the chicken parmesan with alfredo fettuccini for $14.95. came today and the guy tells me to substitute spaghetti for Alfredo parmesan is $10. I said are you sure ? he said yeah. I said ok. so I paid $25 for chicken parmesan and fettuccini alfredo for one person. today was the last day I will ever eat at pasta idea. if you feel like getting over charged for decent food. come here !!!!

Pasta Idea makes the best pasta in Vegas HANDS DOWN! They are always consistent and the service is on point. Hunter serves us almost every time and always does a great job! Do yourself a favor and eat here.

They never disappoint. Do yourself a favor..get the TIRAMISU! I've eaten inside and ordered for pick up. Seems like you get more of the bruschetta when you sit in. I used to order Buca which is right next door to them but not anymore.
Gluten free fettuccine with nearly 40 sauce choices! It's a small place with just a few tables, but it's really a treat for anyone that loves pasta and needs gluten free!

i ordered chicken fettuccine. asked them to add peas. OMG good when i got it, better the second night!!  highly recommend. delivered no less.  this place is amazing! and i never write reviews. hence no punctuation, :)

It's imPASTA-ble to describe how much I love this place but I'll give it a try! 

Whenever I'm in the area or whenever I'm craving pasta (which is pretty much all the time) I love to go to Pasta Idea, especially for their lunch special. It's $9.95 for a create your own pasta (only the ones with a * next to it are eligible) plus a drink and garlic bread with a side of tomatoes and chopped basil. Keep in mind that if you aren't dining here for lunch, the pastas can be a bit pricey BUT the portions are so huge so you can definitely share with another person! They also have delivery through Eat24 and BiteSquad if you just want to eat in but still get your pasta fix! 

For lunch I recommend their pink vodka sauce with spaghetti noodles or their caprese with their cheese ravioli! We usually get those two and always end up super full at the end of our meal. 

The space is pretty small so not ideal for huge groups but I'm sure they can be accommodating since I saw a huge group of 10 today when I picked up my order. Their customer service has always been great (I really miss those two sisters that worked here, haven't seen them anymore though :/) but today it was even more awesome since the guy was able to expedite my order because he knew I was in a rush despite how busy they were! 

Love how their pasta and sauces are handmade and always fresh with authentic Italian chefs behind the kitchen! It's definitely a nice difference from the typical "Olive Garden" or other chain restaurants. I also love supporting local businesses so this is the ideal go to pasta spot for me!

If you're looking for some good pasta - come here. This place is one of a kind and totally worth it!! 
Big portions, delicious, and well-made. The young girl that works here has a fabulous personality - very friendly and funny - she makes our experience great every time. My boyfriend and I come here often but we are about to move, so this place will be for sure missed by both of us. So go in and grab a plate for us since we can't anymore, you won't be sorry!! To the business - I really hope you guys get so big that you can expand all over and more people can enjoy your great food and service. Keep up the great work.

I'm stuffed! 

If there was a 10 star review I'd use it here. The place is super clean, the staff is extremely nice and attentive, but most of all the food... The food is heavenly! I started with the house salad and ordered the Bigoli pasta with meat sauce and meatballs. The salad was as fresh as any I've ever had. It had olives, tomatoes, and buffalo mozzarella on it. Simply divine! The pasta dish was insanely good. Best I've ever had at a restaurant. The meatballs were perfect in every way! 

If you like clean, healthy, delicious food, just go here. You will not be disappointed. 

I'll see you there tomorrow, because I'm going back!
Outstanding food. Fantastic service. I had the baked butternut squash ravioli with speck and mushrooms in a white sauce which was delicious.

Ordered pasta, salad and a desert. Cost me $40 but I decided it seemed worth it. 30 minutes later I get a call saying they were trying to charge $15 extra for the actual pasta. Wtf? How does that make any sense? The food is good but not worth the money or the time.

Wow.. So refreshing to have a real Italian taste in Las Vegas. Thank you Andrea for sharing your amazing kitchen with us.
I had Andrea special. Bigoli pasta with meat sauce.
Amazing.

Amazing food! All pastas are delicious, you can not go wrong. The prosciutto appetizer was amazing and so was the bread and everything else. Hole in the wall atmosphere really small, intimate. Easy 5 star rating for food and service. Service might be different then what you expect but the staff was great.

Came in here once for my lunch break. The service here is excellent. The lady working up front was extremely friendly, and even opened the door for me on my way out. All I ordered was spaghetti with vodka sauce and shrimp. It was super yummy and the portions were huge!! I would definitely check this place out again and wish they had one closer to my house.

If you're looking for a local spot that serves authentic Italian pasta, this is it. The fam and I stopped in for lunch based on reviews and we were not disappointed! In fact, started planning future visits before we finished eating! Gnocchi with meat sauce and gnocchi with pesto was spectactular. Carbonara is next! (Have a feeling we'll be making our way through the menu.) Delicious homemade desserts was the cherry on top. Hubby barely shared his tiramisu and hands down the best cheesecake I've ever had. So glad we found this gem!

You will not find much better than this in town! Pasta Idea is a great concept where you have a price for both the pasta and the sauce.  Pasta's and sauces are made fresh daily and the 3 that we tried were all right on point.  We started with this fantastic fresh made Caprese salad with a beautiful heirloom tomato sliced into 9 pieces sitting on some fresh greens and topped with fresh sliced mozzarella with a balsamic glaze on top.  We just had to finish it all as it was so good and for only $10.95. WOW!  Our server brought us some fresh bread with bruschetta which was a nice touch.  We were getting full already. We each ordered a pasta dish which we soon discovered was to much as week took half of it home for Monday's lunch.  I had the pappardelle puttanesca.  I have not had fresh pappardelle since chef Marc's Parma was open and he only made it special. This is on the menu every day! The puttanesca sauce was fantastic with black tangy olives, nice large capers and small salty slices of anchovy in a fantastic tomato sauce.  The other guys both choose spaghetti with garlic lovers sauce and flavored chicken alfredo sauce.  We all shared each others dish and were more than happy with the flavors.  Even though this is a 30 minute drive for us it is well worth it to drive for a fresh meal like this.  The sauce and pasta combinations are just limitless with this concept.  It is a very small mom and pop place but it is bright and cheerful and the owners take good care of you.  The 3 of us ate for $60.02 including the tax and before the top.  We can not wait to go again.  I posted pics of our meals. Enjoy!

Walking into this place, it seems very small. It has a very cute eating space and our server was very nice. The variety of sauces, meats, and noodles are extensive! That is not a bad thing. You have a lot to choose from and they help you if there are things you do to understand. The meatballs were so good. I chose the creamy alfredo diablo ravioli! If you like it a little spicy, go for it!

The service and food were really good along with the potion sizes. The place is way too high though. We had 3 adult meals and 1 kids meal, no drinks and it was almost $60.00 before tip. I could have gone to Bucca for that price and had sodas and such.

One of the best places in town for pasta dishes with qualify ingredients, delicious recipes and real Italian flavor.  The have a serious variety of options on kinds of pasta, types of sauces and the repertoire of ingredients.  I like the ravioli dishes, mushroom and butternut squash, but the meat dishes look spectacular.  Generous portions is an understatement.  Not for the gluten free crowd.  Service is good but not for large groups.
There sauces and homemade pasta is awesome! Can beat any Italian food in Vegas! All sauces are homemade by real Italians!

So happy to see this place open so close to the house. All of the pastas are made from scratch. The gnocchi special with shrimp, scallops, shrooms and asparagus was really good. The chicken parm was as good as mine. The servers knowledge of the dishes and personality were on point. This will be a regular spot.

Tried this place one night with friends, nice sweet staff & clean store. Lots of choices. Sadly we found the food to be disappointing. Either bland or way over salted. And not very hot for something made to order it was room temp at best. One friend had a dish with so much cheese that u could see the oil separated from the dish and run down.

Great tasting homemade pasta! You choose the pasta, then your choice of sauce. It is a very different concept than anywhere else I've been before but definitely very good. Everything was packed with flavor and so fresh! We will be back again for this. I had the fettuccine with chicken Alfredo sauce and chose to add mushrooms. My husband had the 3 cheese tortellini with marinara. Each meal comes with garlic bread and bruschetta.

If I could give no or under zero stars I would, we did take out seeing this place has been rated so high I wanted so much to love this place. We ordered take out and asked for well done pasta and came home to hard noodles super al dente noodles so hard we couldn't even take even a 2nd bite. We called to say how unhappy we were and they were oblivious to the complaint and even the chef got on the phone to give a run down of how the pasta is cooked in the morning and than cooked again to order and he does not have time to sit and cook my noodles the way I like cause it'll take an hour. I didn't call to be talked down like I'm dumb I called cause we paid over $30 for food we couldn't even eat and couldn't get a word in. This place is good for some but please be aware of the ignorance of not listening and sympathize.
One of THE BEST Italian spots in Las Vegas!!!  Fresh pasta and an abundance of sauce choices...I cannot say enough. It's one of my favorites!!!

Love this place!! My husband and I came for lunch and had a great experience. The girl working was on point, a great server and over all good person. First you get garlic bread with marinara for an app, how awesome is that?! Then our food was amazing and huge portions for lunch but who doesn't like leftover pasta?! I got cheese ravioli with vodka sauce and I'm still having dreams about it a week later  my hubby let our server pick for him and that was amazing too. I love helping out small businesses In the community so we will definitely be back.

I think the idea is great pick pasta, pick your sauce, pick your protein. There are ask many possibilities.  Plus they have specials.  Today I got the short rib ravioli, really creamy sauce the ravioli's stuffed with a generous amount of short ribs. You couldn't ask for more. I also tasted my daughter's mac 'n' cheese get it I would have killed it but she would've like that. The food is cooked by real Italians too so it taste like it should.

Rarely do I leave a restaurant already planning my return, but WOW, Pasta Ideas had me drooling from the appetizer all the way through dessert. Every single bite was delicious...the only negative to my visit is that my stomach isn't bigger. 

Clean. Excellent service. I really couldn't have asked for a better dinner spot.

I brought my lacrosse team here after a tournament and although the place is small, they were more than accommodating with chairs and tables. We ordered several different tray dishes and they were all incredibly tasty. The staff was so nice, always checking to see if everything was okay or if we needed anything else. Best meal (and best pasta) my team has ever had. We will definitely coming back next time we are here. 5 stars!!!!! Thank you PastaIdea!!!

Good... My foodie review.

(Seriously though. Great food,  better service and staff. The tomato and garlic bread they serve before the meal could be on the menu itself. The mushroom ravioli special was to die for! )
Seriously amazing! I'm a food snob, and I'm telling you - the flavor, the presentation, & the quality is on point! This is my new favorite place. The lunch special is a great value too.

It takes a lot for me to make a post like this. I have no idea how this place has good ratings or has stayed in business. We had a group of 4, and it took an hour (with no apologies) for us to get our food. It was not hot and mediocre at best when it did arrive. My pasta cost $18. We should have gone to Bucca di Beppo next door if we wanted tasteless pasta.
I did not like the food much.  My pasta was way over cooked.  Even my kids didn't like their meatballs.  It is really a 'to-go' or lunch place...definitely NOT a dinner restaurant.
Bread was good, bruschetta was delicious, al dente pasta with tasty sauces were served in generous portions. Pretty small place, but good prices and great food. Highly recommendo

My ex boyfriend (6"2,230pounds,never leaves food on the table) and I had to take a doggie bags! Such huge portions, perfectly cooked, and very flavorful.

Tried once we saw on Yelp. Many people there were trying for the first time as well and we overheard comments they were just as happy. 

I had spaghetti and Alfredo, he had pink Diablo. Garlic bread and tomato salad comes with meal- really good.

One less start then perfect ONLY because of the seating/table/limited space. It's kinda cramped and I'm pretty sure I sat on a patio chair inside!

To me this is better than ordering from Olive Garden!  The portions are great and offer many varieties of pasta and sauce combinations!  I was in the mood for rigatoni with meatballs!  However I saw the pink vodka sauce pasta and I think I will get that next.  The meatballs and sauce was very succulent!  The potion was so big I could not finish it.  The only problem I had was the confusion of what came with the menu.  I did not know if the dish came with garlic bread or not.  So I ordered extra!  However it did come with garlic bread.  I also ordered the Caesar salad and my girlfriend ate that she said it was delicious.  You had the option to add chicken or shrimp or both to the salad.  They had choice of meats with the sauce from sausage to chicken and to clams and shrimp! White sauce, pink sauce meat sauce and coordinated with different pasta! The delivery service was on par when used Yelp to order.  I recommend this place to everyone the food was impeccable and the service was great!
This is a great  place to eat. You get your moneys worth. Pasta  taste really good. People are nice   Jeremiahs was great. Excellent overall experience

This place is consistent, and that's something that's hard to find. My food always tastes exactly the same. The homemade pasta is excellent, reminds me of Grandma's on Sunday. The Chicken Parm was excellent, the Pasta Fagoli was excellent, the tomatoe salad excellent! However, the sauce is a little too acidic which in turns gives you heartburn. 

Now for the Cons: Meatballs had absolutely no flavor, does not look homemade, looks like they're shipped in. The Garlic Bread was flavorless and soggy as well.

** CAUTION ** Very pricey, they charge as much as if you ate a fine dining real Italian restaurant. Although they do give you a nice amount of food, they should consider giving some more for the price!

This place is AMAZING!!...The waiters and servers are super nice and extremely attentive to the customers. It's a small place but is packed with AWSOME FLAVORFUL FOOD!.....This is a great place for anyone that is looking to awake your taste buds I highly recommend for you to come a visit a little part of Italy in Las Vegas!!!

The newest pasta shop in town is serving up generous portions of delicious pasta.

We arrived on a weekday night and were surprised by how packed they were. The restaurant is tiny so only a handful of tables are available for dining in. They had a large table reserved for a party that was coming in so we had to wait for one of the already occupied tables to vacate.

Our patience was rewarded and we were seated quickly and allowed to peruse the menu. I was torn between all the great options, but settled on the pappardelle with Diablo sauce. My pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce had a great kick. 

Portions are not for the faint of heart so we had plenty of leftovers after our meal was said and done. Great spot and happy to have this quick serve option in the area.

I found this place via Door Dash and decided to drive to the location and see what all the fuss was about. It's a small local place that has some of the best pasta i've had on the west coast. It's great because it's totally customizable. I had the pink diablo sauce while dining in. It was fantastic. The sausage in the sauce seemed to be high quality. I raved about the place so much we ordered it at work for "Free Lunch Friday". The guys that work for me got Alfredo and I ordered Chicken Parm. Everyone loved this place and asked me for the location so they could go there on their off time. It's seriously a hidden gem of summerlin and I hope they expand to the "deep north" of las vegas so I can go more often.

Great little 8-9 table place tucked back in the i Renee of the strip mall. Went we two friends. I had the lunch special of spaghetti and meatballs for $9.95 including a drink. Sounded expensive at first - but take a look at my picture, enough for two meals plus! The pasta was a thicker noodle with tasty meatballs and plenty of red sauce.  The others were cheese ravioli and chicken Alfredo.   Both plates were generous portions and steaming hot from the kitchen - no warm up or microwave here.  
Enjoyed and looking forward to returning to try other pastas.

Abosolutely outstanding.  Pink Diablo sauce was really good.  Both of girls loved their food.  Wife tried all dishes and liked them all.  Service was great.  If you looking for great authentic Italian Pasta this is your place.
OMG it was so yummy. So many choices. You pick the pasta you want with the sauce you want. Everything is home made and delicious
